title: Staff Product Designer, Central Team
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Staff Product Designer** 
 to join our Central Team. The
 **Central team** 
 focuses on providing one north star experience to all our customers at Wolt. You'll be collaborating closely with research, motion, content design, as well as the design system and operation team.
   

  

 This will be someone who has mastered the craft of turning insights into beautifully designed products, who can inspire organisations through prototyping and storytelling to ensure their final work has maximum impact for the customer.
   

  

**You’re a great fit for this role if you:**
* Drive strategic initiatives and shape broad direction of design
* Operate as a thought leader, communicating and advocating for design decisions across teams and with senior stakeholders, often influencing company-wide decisions
* Handle highly ambiguous and complex problems that require broader perspective, cross functional collaboration, and long term thinking
* Design end to end, crafting visually delightful experiences
* Thrive in complex, ambiguous problem spaces—and enjoy bringing structure, clarity, and direction.
* Are curious about new AI technologies and how we can use them in design


**What You’ll Do**
* Turn ambiguity into clarity. You’ll bring strong framing and product thinking to shape undefined problems into compelling design opportunities.
* Bring ideas to life beautifully. You’ll design intuitive interfaces and interactions that are both delightful and highly usable.
* Prototype to inspire. Through prototyping, storytelling, and systems thinking, you’ll align teams and build momentum—ensuring your work not only ships, but resonates.
* Own the full design stack. From strategy and exploration to refined visuals, you’ll lead high-impact initiatives from start to finish.


**What We’re Looking For**
 We’d love to work with you if:
   

  

* You have 8+ years of experience designing consumer, B2B, or SaaS products—building elegant, business-savvy solutions in complex environments.
* You’re a T-shaped designer with deep strengths in concepting, visual design and prototyping, able to drive high-quality outcomes in a collaborative, cross-functional team.
* You think in systems, not just screens—comfortable designing across diverse journeys and touchpoints.
* You’re a creative problem-solver, excited by ambiguity and energized by complex design challenges.
* You’re open to feedback—comfortable sharing early, learning fast, and evolving ideas with your team.
* You’re a strong communicator and natural storyteller, able to align stakeholders, build empathy, and drive design-led decisions.


**How We Work**
* User first. We listen deeply and design to solve real user problems—not just respond to noise.
* Together, not alone. We work closely with product, engineering, and business partners to find practical, elegant solutions.
* Design-led thinking. Designers at Wolt lead by shaping the problem space and setting the vision.
* Vision, then execution. We dream big, then work backward to make the future real—step by step, as a team.


**What’s Next**
 As a next step, we’d love to see your
 **portfolio** 
 to better understand your design approach and impact. We’re especially interested in work that shows
 **strong visual craft** 
 ,
 **attention to detail** 
 , and
 **real results** 
 . One well-structured Figma file with your best, recent work is more valuable to us than multiple outdated case studies — products move fast, and relevance matters. If you have
 **high-fidelity prototypes** 
 or
 **motion work** 
 , even better. We're excited to see how you think and build.
   

  

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ncz4s\_oBczc
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Manager
description:
Bruce Studios is on a mission to redefine how people train, recover, and feel good – every day.
   

  

 With thousands of members and over 1,000 partner studios across the Nordics, we offer the most flexible way to stay active and well. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Bruce Studios believe that movement should be a natural and joyful part of everyday life — not just a routine, but a source of energy, balance, and connection. As people seek more personalized, flexible, and holistic ways to stay well, Bruce Studios is uniquely positioned to meet that need.
   

  

 Growth is driven by data, design, and deep user insight — but at the core, Bruce Studios is a community company. They are expanding fast across regions, product areas, and digital touchpoints, and building a platform that makes health and wellbeing more accessible, more social, and more sustainable.
   

  

 Bruce Studios is now looking for a strategic, commercially minded, and execution-focused Product Manager to help shape and drive the product offering into its next phase.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in developing and executing Bruce’s product vision and roadmap. You will define and prioritize key features and initiatives that enhance the overall experience for both members and partner studios, leveraging data, insights, and technology.
   

  

 We're looking for someone who:
   

  

* Delivers results - but always builds with the future in mind.
* Brings clarity and accountability - and leads with heart.
* Builds scalable systems - and a high-performance culture.
* Loves solving complex challenges with structure, data, and people.


 You'll play a key role in ensuring that Bruce Studios continues to scale in a smart, focused, and human way - while embedding data, design, and technology into every step.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
* Own and manage specific areas of Bruce Studios' product roadmap, ensuring alignment with strategic business goals.
* Collaborate closely with Design, Tech, Operations, Marketing, and Studios to deliver seamless, engaging, and scalable product experiences.
* Drive product discovery, clearly defining user needs and translating these into actionable solutions.
* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success, including member growth, partner satisfaction, churn, and CLV.
* Foster a data-driven, hypothesis-driven product development culture, including A/B testing and iterative improvements.
* Continuously gather market intelligence and user feedback, identifying opportunities for innovation and improvement.
* Actively contribute to embedding AI-driven personalization and automation into our member and partner journeys.
* Support the implementation of product rituals and frameworks (e.g., OKRs, sprint planning, weekly prioritization) to maintain momentum and clarity.


**What We Want You To Bring**
* 3+ years of experience in product management within digital, member-focused, or marketplace-driven environments.
* Proven track record of launching and optimizing digital products and features that drive measurable commercial impact.
* Comfortable working with data and analytics tools to inform product decisions and demonstrate outcomes.
* Experience working in cross-functional teams, effectively collaborating with designers, developers, marketers, and operational stakeholders.
* Passionate about delivering exceptional user experiences with a strong focus on UX and design.
* Understanding or experience with subscription-based services, marketplaces, and the wellness or fitness industry is seen as a great advantage.
* Excellent communication skills, able to clearly articulate and champion product decisions.
* Proactive, curious, and driven by achieving clear, measurable results.
* This is your opportunity to be part of shaping the future of wellness at BruceStudios, contributing to a product that truly makes a difference in people's lives.


**Our values at Bruce Studios**
 At Bruce Studios, our values guide everything we do—from how we work together to how we engage with our community.
   

  

* Own it – We take responsibility, make decisions, and follow through. We’re proactive, honest, and always learning from our mistakes.
* Be engaged – We’re all in. We respect each other’s time, stay curious, and continuously strive to improve.
* Be real – Authenticity is key. We communicate openly, support each other, and create a safe space where everyone can be themselves.
* Be adaptable – Change is constant, and we embrace it. We find solutions, stay flexible, and innovate together.
* Be bold – We challenge the status quo, take risks, and push boundaries while treatingeach other with kindness and respect.


 Want to be part of a team that lives these values every day? Apply now.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Fully renovated top-floor office with terrace, ideally located in central Stockholm
* 30 days of vacation
* Pension benefits
* Hybrid work setup with three office days per week
* A welcoming company culture and supportive team
* A Bruce Epic membership (yes, you get to workout too!)


**How To Apply**
 Does this role sound like the right fit for you? Great – we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 In this recruitment, Bruce Studios partner up with the recruitment specialist, David
   

  

 Källström, at Uniqruit.
   

  

 We value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we warmly welcome applicants of all gender identities, ages, backgrounds, and abilities.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 You'll work closely with designers, engineers, specialist stakeholders, and the Product director to develop consumer facing products, which form a core part of our platform and value proposition. You will act as the voice of our customers and be a stable bridge between engineering and the business. You will also help the team function as an empowered product team by setting the right product culture and vision, and help the team deliver high quality impactful features.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll stand over the one of the exciting product suite at Juni. Your R&R would cover:
   

  

* Product Strategy and Vision: Defining the strategic direction of your area, aligning them with the company's overall business strategy. This involves creating product roadmaps that outline planned features and enhancements based on customer feedback, competitors, market demands and business priorities.
* Customer Experience: Lead the vision for financial experience within the platform- bank transfer, invoice payment, credit usage etc. Ensure the financial and banking features are chain-linked into cohesive end-to-end workflows. Work with designers to build UX that WoWs customers.
* Empowered Product Team: Setting the right product culture within your product team that empowers all team members to empathise with customer pain points and understand the impact of features they are building.
* Customer Research: Conduct thorough customer research to understand customer (ICP) needs, market trends, and the competitive landscape. This includes gathering insights through customer interviews, surveys, and data analysis.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Working closely with various departments such as engineering, design, commercial, and finance to ensure effective product development and launch. This includes facilitating communication and alignment among different teams.
* Product Development Oversight: Managing the product backlog, prioritizing features, and working closely with development teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery of banking products
* Market Positioning and training: Developing strategies for positioning and pricing products in the market. Ensuring that the commercial teams have been trained on product features and value propositions clearly understood by all.


**Within 1 Month You Will**
* Understand how Juni’s product teams work
* Be integrated with your team
* Ship your first features 🚢


**Within 3 Months You Will Have**
* Stronghold of your teams' growth metrics
* Deep understanding of your team’s roadmap
* Shipped many features and fix critical bugs 🐛


**Within 6 Months You Will**
* Oversee delivery against your metrics and roadmap (with some bumps along the way)
* Set 12-month rolling vision for your product domain
* Actively participate in customer research to understand the voice of customer


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Google suite
* Notion
* BI tools
* Slack


**Qualifications 👑**
 What we need to see:
   

  

* Familiarity with fintech and financial services (preferably from Sweden)
* Experience in activation, onboarding, pricing
* Good understanding of Swedish and global payment eco-system
* 3+ years of product manager experience


**What We’d Love To See**
* Experience in working with sales, onboarding and credit teams
* 5+ years of overall experience
* Engineering or computer science degree


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Junior Web Editor
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Design Services, and Public Safety
description:
**Securitas Group** 




 For 90 years, we have helped keep your world safe. It's a purpose we continue to pursue in today's complex and ever-changing world because everyone deserves to feel safe.
 



  





 Securitas is a world-leading safety and security solutions partner that
 **help make your world a safer place** 
 . By leveraging technology in collaboration with our clients, we provide a comprehensive portfolio of value-enhancing services and solutions integrated throughout the security value chain – from on-site services to advanced monitoring, comprehensive risk prediction, and advisory services.
 



  





 Guided by our values of integrity, vigilance, and helpfulness, we create sustainable value by assisting our clients in optimizing their operations and protecting what matters most - their people and assets. With more than 330,000 colleagues across 44 markets and nine decades of deep expertise, we see what others miss and create sustainable value for our clients.
 



  





 We’re now looking for a
 **Junior Web Editor** 
 to
 **join our Group Communications team** 
 — someone who thrives on structure, coordination, and digital innovation.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As our new Junior Web Editor, you’ll play a key role in managing and evolving our digital presence. In this role, you’ll act as a key coordinator across teams, ensuring that web content is accurate, timely, and aligned with business goals while also supporting the technical and operational aspects of our digital platforms.
 



  





 You’ll work closely with developers, designers, and communicators to keep our Group website running smoothly and effectively. In this role, you’ll collaborate with stakeholders across international markets and at Group level, ensuring alignment and consistency in our digital presence. Your ability to bring structure, manage multiple stakeholders, and stay ahead of deadlines will be essential. You’ll also play a role in exploring how AI tools can support smarter workflows and more efficient content operations.
 



  





 This is a great opportunity to grow in a
 **global organization** 
 , working with a
 **small, collaborative team** 
 that values initiative, clarity, and continuous improvement.
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 



* Coordinating updates and improvements to the Group website and other digital platforms.
* Acting as a liaison between content owners, developers, and designers to ensure smooth execution of web projects.
* Maintaining structured processes for content updates, approvals, and publishing.
* Monitoring content accuracy, consistency, and performance and flag opportunities for improvement.
* Supporting the integration of AI-powered tools to streamline workflows, enhance quality control, and improve user experience.
* Tracking and reporting on web performance metrics using tools like GA4.
* Ensuring content aligns with SEO, accessibility, and UX best practices.
* This role may also include additional tasks and responsibilities beyond those listed above, depending on team needs and your interests and strengths.



  





**Who you are** 



* You bring
 **3–5 years of experience** 
 in web coordination, digital communications, or content planning, creation and management.
* You have a degree in Communications, Marketing, Journalism, or another related field.
* You are comfortable working with
 **CMS platforms** 
 and have a basic understanding of HTML/CSS. You are familiar with SEO, UX/UI principles, and web analytics (especially GA4).
* You are a strong communicator in
 **English** 
 (Swedish is a plus), with a collaborative mindset and attention to detail.
* You are organized, proactive, and thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
* You are a team player who also works well independently and takes initiative.



  





**Working conditions** 




 The role is based in Stockholm and involves occasional travel as needed. It's a hybrid working model.
 



  





**Why join us?** 



* Be part of a strong, purpose-driven organization guided by clear values of integrity, vigilance, and helpfulness.
* Join a team of experts in external communications, internal communications, PR, and crisis communications, all working together to elevate our brand and impact.
* Work in a collaborative, supportive environment that values structure, innovation, and initiative.
* Enjoy opportunities for professional growth, cross-functional collaboration, and meaningful contributions to high-impact projects.



  





 If you’re ready to bring structure, coordination, and curiosity to a dynamic digital team, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Head of Design
description:
**About**
 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As the Head of Design for Battery Systems in our Operations department, you will be responsible for leading and developing the technical work within design and production improvement of complete battery systems and related mechanical and electrical components. You will ensure that solutions meet requirements in terms of performance, safety, cost, and manufacturability, in close collaboration with cross-functional teams and the R&D department.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead the design work for battery systems in customer projects.
* Be responsible for the team's deliveries within mechanical and electrical design


 (CAD, drawings, specifications).
   

  

* Ensure technical quality and compliance with requirements, structural integrity,


 thermal management, enclosure design, and product interfaces.
   

  

* Ensure that the product and its components are tested before delivery to the


 customer.
   

  

* Be responsible for ensuring that product and customer documentation is


 accurate and usable.
   

  

* Coordinate with production, purchasing, and project management departments.
* Develop and implement design standards, tools, and processes.
* Drive technical decisions in design reviews and act as the technical requirements


 owner in projects.
   

  

* Support industrialization and production adaptation in collaboration with


 production and suppliers.
   

  

* Be responsible for competence development, recruitment, and leadership within


 the design team.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* At least 7 years of experience in the design of complex systems, preferably within


 battery technology, the automotive or shipping industry, or energy storage.
   

  

* Experience with CAD tools (e.g., CATIA, Creo, SolidWorks), electrical design tools


 (e.g., E-Plan), and PDM systems.
   

  

* Knowledge of battery safety, thermal- and structure design, EMC, and IP


 classification is a plus.
   

  

* Previous experience as a team leader, project manager, or in a managerial role is


 highly meritorious.
   

  

* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English


**Why Join Echandia Marine?**
**Impact** 
 : Work on groundbreaking technology that will shape the future of sustainable marine transport.
   

  

**Growth** 
 : Develop your skills in a dual role that combines technical leadership with product strategy.
   

  

**Innovation** 
 : Join a culture that values creativity, collaboration and innovation at every level.
   

  

**Mission** 
 : Be part of a purpose-driven company working to make the marine industry cleaner and more efficient.
   

  

 The right candidate will be part of a fast growing, non-hierarchical and business focused scale-up company fighting climate change through zero-emission electrification.
   

  

 Echandia is challenging the maritime industry with safer electrification. Since its founding in 2018, Echandia has rapidly become a global leader in maritime battery systems, delivering nearly 70 systems for electrification projects worldwide. Our systems are tailored to optimize energy efficiency and reduce environmental impact, supporting the maritime industry’s transition towards sustainable operations. Based in Stockholm, we serve customers across the globe.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re hiring a Senior Product Designer to shape the core experience of the most intuitive legal platform in the world. You’ll work end-to-end—exploring ideas, crafting clear interfaces, and refining details in close collaboration with engineers. The role is execution-first: your strength lies in turning complex workflows into simple, powerful interfaces, especially as we design new patterns for working with AI.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design user flows, interactions, and interfaces for AI-powered tools
* Turn ambiguous problems into concrete, high-quality product experiences
* Work hands-on with engineers to bring your designs to life
* Use Figma to design, document, and iterate with speed
* Contribute to—and help scale—our design system
* Push for clarity, consistency, and quality in every corner of the product


 Who you are
   

  

* Strong experience designing digital products end-to-end
* A portfolio that shows clear thinking, elegant UI, and shipped product work
* Sharp visual skills and attention to detail
* Curiosity about how AI changes user behavior and interfaces
* Pragmatism and a bias toward shipping over theorizing


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Vice President Product & Digital Engineering
description:
*We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*
*At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation & technology. In 2023 we launched our new mother brand, Strawberry, and we are transforming from a traditional hotel company to a universe of offers and experiences for our guests and customers.*
 We are seeking a visionary
 **Vice President Product & Digital Engineering.** 
 You will be instrumental in delivering innovative and seamless digital experiences that drive commercial growth and maximize operational efficiency. Leading our teams across Tech Product, Digital Engineering, Integration and QA, you will cultivate a world-class engineering culture and ensure the scalability, security, and performance of all digital solutions.
   

  

 If you possess strong technical and strategic acumen, commercial insight, and a talent for building impactful relationships, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Tech Product & Technical Vision: Define and champion the tech product vision and technical roadmap for tech products, platforms, and AI-powered solutions, ensuring deep alignment with business objectives and a cost-effective product policy.
* User-Centered Design: Lead a selection of our Product & Design teams in creating intuitive, engaging, and effective user experiences for guests and employees, grounded in solid user research and technical feasibility.
* Engineering Excellence: Direct the Digital Engineering teams through the full lifecycle of developing, deploying, and maintaining highly scalable, secure, and performant digital solutions, championing modern engineering practices and architectural principles.
* Platform & API Strategy: Drive the evolution of our core API and platform capabilities to ensure seamless system integration, reusability, and robust extensibility for future growth.
* Quality & Security: Enforce rigorous standards for software quality, performance, security, and data governance, overseeing QA functions and advocating for automation, CI/CD pipelines, and responsible AI practices.
* Leadership & Mentorship: Build, mentor, and develop high-performing teams across Tech Product and Engineering, fostering a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Work effectively across functions to translate business needs into clear, technically feasible tech product requirements and engineering specifications.
* Financial Management: Develop and manage the comprehensive budget for the technology product development organization, ensuring effective resource allocation.


**Who We Think You Are**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Product Management, or a related technical field; a Master’s degree is preferred.
* 10+ years of progressive experience in product management and/or digital engineering leadership roles.
* A proven track record of successfully launching impactful digital products and scalable platforms, with demonstrable experience leading the development of AI-powered features.
* Deep understanding of product development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Lean, OKR), modern architectures, and CI/CD and DevOps principles.
* Significant experience leading and scaling cross-functional product, design, and engineering teams.
* Strong foundational knowledge of API design (REST, GraphQL), microservices, cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), and AI/ML principles.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical and AI strategies to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong commercial acumen and the ability to align technical decisions with business value and ROI.
* Experience within the hospitality industry is a plus.


**What We Offer**
**Real Impact:** 
 Be a part of a dynamic transformation and contribute directly to our success story.
   

  

**Empowerment:** 
 Work in a flat organization with trust, autonomy, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
   

  

**Growth & Development:** 
 Access professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
   

  

**Fun & Community:** 
 Enjoy a vibrant work environment with plenty of social events and team-building activities.
   

  

**Fantastic Perks:** 
 Benefit from great employee discounts, including staff and friends & family rates at our hotels.
   

  

**Flexible Work:** 
 Embrace a hybrid working model with your base at our HQ in Oslo or Stockholm.
   

  

 You will be a part of the leadership team in the Tech department, and report directly to CDTO, Kari Anna Fiskvik.
   

  

 Interested in joining our team?
   

  

 We'd love to get to know you! At Strawberry, we celebrate individuality and potential, and invite all to apply. Upload your CV and cover letter, sharing why this position excites you.

title: Quality Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
*Vill du jobba i uppdrag där kvalitet, teknik och affärsvärde hänger ihop – på riktigt? Hos oss får du kombinera din tekniska förmåga med strategiskt ansvar, i team där kvalitet ses som en självklar del av utvecklingen.*
 Som QA-konsult/Quality Engineer på Sopra Steria har du en nyckelroll i att säkerställa att våra kunders digitala lösningar håller hög kvalitet – både tekniskt och ur användarperspektiv. Du ansvarar för att ta fram teststrategier, bygga upp testautomation, sätta strukturer och coacha team kring kvalitet. Du arbetar nära utvecklare, produktägare och verksamhet i agila team där du bidrar till att skapa spårbarhet, testbarhet och datadrivna beslut.
   

  

 Våra kunder har höga krav på kvalitet – vilket innebär att du sällan behöver övertyga om varför test behövs. Istället får du samarbeta med andra som förstår och värdesätter det du gör, och där din tekniska kompetens verkligen kommer till sin rätt.
   

  

**Vi tror att du har:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som QA-konsult/Quality Engineer eller liknande
* Vana att skriva kod – t.ex. i Java, JavaScript eller Python.
* Erfarenhet av moderna test- och automatiseringsverktyg (t.ex. Cypress, Playwright, Selenium).
* Förmåga att ta fram teststrategier och coacha andra kring kvalitet i agila team.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Det är meriterande om du även har:**
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines och automatiserade byggprocesser.
* Jobbat med containerteknik som Docker och Kubernetes.
* Testledarerfarenhet eller ansvar för större kvalitetsstrategier.


 Det viktigaste för oss är att du har ett tekniskt driv och en stark förståelse för hur kvalitet påverkar både kod, affär och användarupplevelse.
   

  

**Varför välja Sopra Steria?**
 I vårt Quality-team är vi över 30 QA-konsulter, kravanalytiker och UX-designers som gillar att dela kunskap, hjälpas åt och ligga i teknikens framkant. Vi tror på frihet under ansvar och värnar om balans mellan arbete och fritid. Kompetensutveckling är en självklar del av din vardag – både genom interna initiativ och utbildningar. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till samhällsnytta, samtidigt som du är en del av ett bolag som rankas som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place to Work. Och du får kollegor som brinner för kvalitet, teknik – och riktigt bra fika till kaffet!
   

  

**Låter det som din nästa utmaning?**
 Skicka ansök direkt med CV och/eller LinkedIn-profil – vi rekryterar löpande! Har du frågor? Hör av dig till Hanna Korell på
 **hanna.korell@soprasteria.com** 
 .
   

  

 På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Processen består av tre intervjuer och personlighets- och logiktest, samt referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll
   

  

 📍
 **Placering:** 
 Stockholm (hybrid)
   

  

 ⏳
 **Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Product Information Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Responsible for designing the architecture of documentation systems, ensuring that complex technical information is presented clearly, logically, and is easily accessible by different user groups (developers, engineers, customers). collaborate closely with technical writers, developers, product managers, and UX designers to create documentation structures that meet user needs.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Information Architecture Design: Design clear, user-friendly documentation structures and metadata for easy navigation and reuse.
* Content Strategy and Management: Define and maintain modular, standardized content to ensure consistency and adaptability.
* Collaboration with Technical and Product Teams: Work with SMEs and product teams to ensure content structure reflects product logic and user needs.
* Search and Retrieval Optimization: Improve findability through metadata, tagging, and well-organized content architecture.
* Tools and Technologies: Manage and optimize content tools and systems to support efficient documentation workflows.
* User Research and Usability Testing: Use feedback and testing to ensure documentation structures meet user expectations
* Compliance and Standardization: Ensure documentation meets quality, regulatory, and version control requirements.


**The skills you bring:**
* Bachelor's degree in Information Architecture, Technical Communication, Information Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in information architecture, technical documentation, or content management for complex technical products.
* Strong understanding of information architecture principles, including taxonomy, metadata, content modeling, and usability.
* Proficiency with documentation tools
* Familiarity with HTML, XML, CSS, and basic knowledge of API documentation.
* Strong analytical skills and experience working with structured content (modular content, topic-based authoring).
* Experience with content management systems (CMS) and knowledge management platforms.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across technical and non-technical teams.
* Familiarity with usability testing, user research, and iterative design methodologies.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 2nd July 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Lovina Rebeiro, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at lovina.rebeiro@ericsson.com
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 768129

title: Product Owner, Group Applications
description:
**Passionate people create exceptional things**
 Did you know that the solutions we develop are a key part of most industries? Electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more.
   

  

 We´re everywhere! Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations. With our inclusive and caring environment, you get the support and inspiration you need to grow.
   

  

 Here, your ideas are embraced, and you never stop learning. Interested in being part of our team?
   

  

**Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.**
**The Role**
 Do you want to help drive the development and lifecycle of the Group Functions application portfolio and lead digital transformation in its supported processes across the organization? Do you enjoy working in an agile environment, close to internal customers, where new initiatives and possibilities are constantly emerging and the products are delivered and continuously improved to accelerate productivity of thousands of users?
   

  

 Come and join our team, Group Applications, in Atlas Copco Group IT!
   

  

 In the role of the Product Owner, your principal responsibility is to deliver and maintain the Group Functions IT applications in line with Atlas Copco’s business needs while safeguarding system and data integrity for all our supported customers.
   

  

 You may lead a highly motivated virtual, cross-regional team, delivering quality solutions for our customers. Your team will be a combination of internally assigned personnel and external service providers.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities**
**Strategy**
* Responsible for product portfolio positioning (vision, architecture, roadmap)
* Align with business stakeholders in setting priorities and driving product projects
* Develop and maintain product and technology roadmap
* Establish product governance structure
* Create Service Operating Model and define KPIs
* Develop marketing and communication strategy
* Solution Financial Management


**Demand to Delivery**
* Responsible for designing, developing/acquiring, piloting, and delivering the Group Functions IT applications in line with Atlas Copco’s group business needs
* Work closely with the function teams and business stakeholders to identify, evaluate and align core business needs
* Prioritize development requests and ensure quality delivery
* Define technical aspects, plan resources, and create exit criteria of POC/MVP
* Monitor testing, plan product launch and ensure robust go-to-production procudure
* Preapre for Service Readiness: unit price, charge model, governance body, documentation


**Operation**
* Responsible for maintaining the Group Functions IT applications in line with Atlas Copco’s group business needs, leading technology solutions globally while safeguarding operational governance
* Design and implement product support process, including documentation and procedures for 1st, 2nd and 3rd level support
* Oversee supplier management and delivery quality of the Managed Services; manage escalations in line with the delivery model.
* Drive product adoption with support of regional delivery team
* Monitor and improve product performance (incidents, requests, usability, CSI, etc.)
* Improve customer experiences to enhance productivity
* Supervise change management and release management; lead rollout of the product and new functions
* Drive marketing, training and communication initiatives; manage business key users’ community
* Ensure product compliance including access management, technical debt, and adherence to (local) regulations.
* Perform cost analysis and financial control with Business Control's support
* Implement Productized Way of Working


**Location**
* Stockholm, Sweden


**Experience Requirements**
* Several years of experience in IT applications, preferable in Financial domain
* Involved in application development in a large, complex, multi-location organization
* Experience with IT best practice/ITIL
* Several years IT Service Management experience
* Proven Project Management and Business Analysis capabilities


**Technical Skills**
* Experienced with all aspects of business applications life cycle management
* Wide knowledge of general business process and practices related to the financial domain.
* Knowledge in web development standards (.NET, JSP, J2EE, etc.) is a plus


**Educational Requirements**
* University degree or equivalent experience
* Certification within ITIL (Foundation) is a benefit


**Key Behaviours and Competencies**
* A person with a passion for the job
* Ability to think practically and creatively as part of a team – must enjoy problem-solving and be motivated by finding solutions to daily challenges!
* Be an excellent communicator, team player and business collaborator with the ability to translate technical topics to business outcomes into simple briefings for non-technical stakeholders
* A methodical and structured achiever, who can plan, organize, prioritize, assess, adapt and deliver to promise
* A resilient person who can cope with change in an ever faster moving digital landscape
* An innovative "there is always a better way" person with a positive, flexible and responsive mindset who embraces and promotes digital transformation
* Open-minded with a global mindset, curious to understand and learn new perspectives and technologies


**In return we offer you**
* A culture known for respectful interaction, ethical behaviour, and integrity.
* Plenty of opportunities to grow and develop your own career path.
* Potential to see your ideas realized and to make an impact.
* Have the flexibility and freedom to keep a healthy work live balance.
* New challenges and new things to learn every day.
* Access to global job opportunities, as part of the Atlas Copco Group.


**Additional Information**
 We review applications on an ongoing basis. However, due to the summer holiday period, the recruitment process will be finalized in August.
   

  

**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**
 Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

title: Medior Fullstack Agile Engineer
description:

title: Mobile iOS Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for mobile application development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you. The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Mobile iOS Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile IOS Developer**
 You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, make specifications and break down implementation work (epics and stories).
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Take part in end user testing activities.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of experience in iOS app development, mainly with Swift.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with git, continuous integration and delivery practices.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.
* Technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar. Bachelor's degree or higher preferred.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following – development of mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, Swift UI, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, security technologies such as TLS, Keychain, MFA, OAuth and PKI, iOS development, cross platform languages such as React native (expo), Kotlin multi-platform or Flutter, SAFe agile methodology. I addition, you share our belief in lean and agile values, with an open mind set, cross-functional teams, where many competences are working together for successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere
* Hybrid working model with minimum of 2 office days per week


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
* Application Deadline: Dec. 31, 2025
* Hybrid


**Job Description**
**What you'll get to do**
 You'll play a pivotal role in moving our new frontend forward, collaborating closely with your team to deliver innovative solutions that delight our users. You´ll team up with frontenders in the team to drive all of our technical projects on the Frontend side and create the best possible plattform for Detectify and our customers. You'll work in a cloud-first environment, leveraging your expertise to create scalable and performant applications that make a significant impact on our product and the user experience.
   

  

 We foster an enabling and empowered culture where you'll have the freedom to utilize your full skill set and express your unique personality. We encourage open, passionate discussions to fuel our collective learning and growth, creating a fun and engaging environment where your contributions are valued.
   

  

**As an Front-end engineer in a cross-functional product team** 
 , you'll contribute to the entire development cycle: ideation to iteration, and everything in between:

* Drive architecture together with your team within your domain and contribute to decisions across teams

 This position is for the Stockholm office.

title: Sektionschef Tjänsteutveckling till E-hälsomyndigheten
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care and Government Administration
description:
Är du en trygg ledare med förmåga att visa riktningen framåt? Drivs du av att påverka samhället på riktigt? Då kan det här vara en roll för dig.
   

  

 Vi är en organisation i tillväxt och förändring, vilket ger dig ett strategiskt ansvar för att visa riktningen framåt för chefer och medarbetare, även när vägvalen inte är självklara.
   

  

****Om tjänsten****
 I rollen som sektionschef hos oss ansvarar du för en sektion bestående just nu av två enheter: verksamhet och produktledning, samverkansarkitektur och UX. Enhetschefer rapporterar direkt till dig. Du leder sektionens verksamhet och ledningsgrupp. Du rapporterar till avdelningschefen och ingår i avdelningens ledningsgrupp.
   

  

 Rollen som sektionschef införs med anledning av vår tillväxt, vilket ger dig möjlighet att påverka hur det nya chefsledet ska utvecklas. Kontaktytorna i jobbet är många och du nätverkar både internt och externt för att driva verksamheten framåt. Du har en central roll i vår samhällsviktiga verksamhet där vi erbjuder digitala lösningar för hälsa, vilket ger medarbetare i vården bättre förutsättningar och ökar patientsäkerheten.
   

  

****Om sektionen****
 Sektionen ansvarar för att leda och samordna utvecklingsarbete och samverkansarkitektur för en fungerande nationell digital infrastruktur inom hälsa, vård och omsorg. Arbetet omfattar prioritering av utvecklingsinsatser, säkerställande av produktägarskap samt att skapa samordning mellan linjeorganisation och nätverksbaserade uppdrag. Sektionen hanterar både strategiska verksamhetskrav och arkitektoniska aspekter, såsom referens- och verksamhetsarkitektur, samt driver arkitekturrådet. Dessutom arbetar sektionen med UX-frågor genom prototyper, piloter och användningsfall. Varje enhet inom sektionen består av 15–20 medarbetare.
   

  

****Om dig****
 Vi söker dig som är trygg och tydlig i ditt ledarskap. Du är samarbetsinriktad och skapar relationer på alla nivåer i organisationen. Du leder i förändring och kommer med idéer på hur verksamheten och individer kan utvecklas. I din förändringsledning är du strategisk och tar ett helhetsperspektiv. Det är en självklarhet för dig att ta ansvar för såväl ditt eget arbete som för fattade beslut.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* akademisk utbildning inom relevant område (om lägst 180hp eller 120p enligt det gamla systemet)
* minst 5 års erfarenhet av chefskap
* aktuell erfarenhet av att leda ett omfattande förändringsarbete
* aktuell erfarenhet av att leda andra chefer/ledarbefattningar
* mycket god förmåga att utrycka dig på svenska i tal och skrift


**Det är meriterande för tjänsten om du har:**
* aktuell erfarenhet som chef inom verksamhet med fokus på hälsa och digitalisering
* erfarenhet av att samordna utvecklingsarbete och samverkansarkitektur
* erfarenhet av rollen business owner inom det agila ramverket SAFe (på minst tågnivå)
* erfarenhet av att bygga upp en ny verksamhet i en organisation


****Vad erbjuder vi?****
 Vi är en myndighet i tillväxt. E-hälsomyndigheten erbjuder dig att vara med och skapa samhällsnytta. Vi arbetar med stora transaktionskritiska system som påverkar samhället, till exempel e-recept och Läkemedelskollen.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du att omges av trevliga och kompetenta arbetskamrater, på en myndighet med ett flertal viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
   

  

 På E-hälsomyndigheten har alla medarbetare förtroendearbetstid och möjlighet att arbeta delvis på distans. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: Jobba hos oss
   

  

****Är du intresserad?****
 Frågor angående tjänsten besvaras av:
   

  

 Avdelningschef Peter Alvinsson: 010-458 62 50
   

  

 Frågor angående rekryteringsprocessen besvaras av:
   

  

 HR-specialist Gabriela Plachecka: gabriela.plachecka@ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och cv via vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den
 **8 juli 2025** 
 . Ladda gärna upp examensbevis, betyg och intyg som är relevanta för tjänsten i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

 Urvalsfrågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen.
 **Att besvara urvalsfrågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.** 
 Det är därför viktigt att du svarar tydligt och utförligt på urvalsfrågorna och inte hänvisar till andra handlingar t.ex. CV.
   

  

 Vi kommer att genomföra löpande intervjuer under ansökningstiden men beslut kommer inte att fattas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort för anställningen är
 **Stockholm eller Kalmar** 
 . Arbetet kan innebära tjänsteresor, främst mellan de två orterna.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. Därför kan vi komma att behöva genomföra en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). För en del arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Om du har beslut om skyddade personuppgifter, kontakta den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen.
   

  

****Om E-hälsomyndigheten****
 E-hälsomyndigheten driver utvecklingen av den nationella digitala infrastrukturen inom hälsa, vård och omsorg. Vi skapar förutsättningar för digitala tjänster och lösningar för privatpersoner och professioner inom hälso- och sjukvård, apotek och socialtjänst. Vi arbetar för att hälsodata ska bli tillgängliga i hela vårdkedjan, oavsett var individer får vård.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar cirka 500 medarbetare fördelat på två orter, Kalmar och Stockholm. Läs mer om oss på www.ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Rekryteringen sköts av E-hälsomyndighetens HR-enhet och vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.

title: Software Engineer III, End User Performance
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
* 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields.
* 2 years of experience building developer tools (e.g., compilers, automated releases, code design and testing, test automation frameworks).
* Experience developing accessible technologies.

**About the job**
-----------------


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.



The End User Performance (EUP) team mission is to prevent performance and media quality regressions from affecting end users across all of Workspace. The team focuses on proactively identifying and resolving issues before they impact user experience by implementing centralized regression prevention infrastructure and working directly with Workspace teams to improve their regression prevention capabilities. The EUP team has prevented numerous regressions in critical areas, ensuring a high-quality experience for millions of users. EUP is part of the Media and Performance Development Infrastructure team. Our work is impacting the quality of meets and other workspace apps by giving engineers actionable and measurable insight into how their work affects product performance and quality.


Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Write product or system development code.
* Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
* Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
* Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
* Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.
company_description: Our mission is to organize the world’s information and make it universally accessible and useful.

title: Commercial Manager IT & Security
description:
Vill du leda utvecklingen av framtidens IT- och cybersäkerhetserbjudanden för Sveriges småföretag – med fullt kommersiellt ansvar?


Telekombranschen förändras snabbt – och för Sveriges småföretag blir smarta, säkra IT-lösningar alltmer affärskritiska. Vi söker nu dig som vill utveckla, paketera och lansera marknadsledande IT- och cybersäkerhetslösningar som ger småföretag trygghet och konkurrenskraft. Är du vår nästa Commercial Manager inom IT & Säkerhet?


**Din nästa möjlighet?**

I rollen som Commercial Manager har du en nyckelroll med både det kommersiella och finansiella ansvaret för erbjudandeportföljen IT & Säkerhet. Du identifierar möjligheter baserat på marknads- och kundinsikter och ansvarar för att sätta en plan, leverera enligt planen och följa upp resultatet – inklusive att utveckla långsiktiga kommersiella strategier i linje med företagets mål och kundernas behov.


Det här är en roll för en strategisk tänkare med stark affärsmässig förståelse, som kan balansera finansiella mål med operativ excellens för att förbättra den övergripande affären och tjänstepaketering. Du har ett stort ansvar för vår framgång och tillväxt, i ett område där vi vill expandera och nå ut till fler kunder med våra erbjudanden.


**Huvudakliga ansvarsområden:**

* Helhetsansvar för erbjudandets affärsutveckling, lönsamhet och tillväxt – från idé till färdig produkt/tjänst och genom hela livscykeln
* Identifierar småföretagens utmaningar och behov inom IT och säkerhet, genom analys av kundinsikter och marknadstrender
* Sätta kommersiella mål och budget, följer upp affärsresultat och ansvarar för prissättning, paketering och marknadsstrategi
* Driva projekt från idé till lansering tillsammans med teknik, sälj och marknad – och ständigt optimerar utifrån data, kundfeedback och affärsresultat
* Leda det finansiella arbetet kring erbjudandeportföljen, inklusive utveckling och uppföljning av resultatrapporter (P&L), analys av finansiell data, prognoser och intäktsstyrning.

**Är det här du?**

För att lyckas i rollen söker vi en erfaren affärsperson, gärna med dokumenterad erfarenhet inom IT/säkerhet eller affärsutveckling. Du har eller har haft kommersiellt och/eller finansiellt ansvar för produkt- eller tjänsteerbjudanden, gärna med fokus på små- och medelstora företag. Vi tror att du har ett intresse för att använda teknik på bästa sätt för kundens nytta och brinner för att omsätta kundinsikter till nya, användarvänliga och värdeskapande erbjudanden.


**Din erfarenhet:**

* Flerårig erfarenhet av affärsutveckling, produktledning eller kommersiell utveckling inom IT, telekom eller cybersäkerhet
* Har/haft kommersiellt och/eller finansiellt ansvar för produkt- eller tjänsteerbjudanden, gärna med fokus på små- och medelstora företag
* Brinner för att omsätta kundinsikter till nya, användarvänliga och värdeskapande erbjudanden
* Är analytisk, strukturerad och datadriven, och ser ständiga förbättringar som en självklar del av rollen
* Är van vid att driva utvecklingsprojekt med många intressenter – och har förmåga att skapa engagemang både internt och hos kund
* Har ett kommersiellt driv och förstår hela kedjan från koncept till sälj, prissättning och lönsamhet

**Vi erbjuder dig:**

* En nyckelroll med **fullt kommersiellt och finansiellt ansvar** för vårt IT- och cybersäkerhetserbjudande mot småföretag
* Möjlighet att driva innovation i en bransch med högt tempo och stor påverkan
* Ett värderingsstyrt bolag med höga ambitioner och snabba beslutsvägar
* En kultur som uppmuntrar samarbete, nytänkande och personlig utveckling!

**Telia är mer än bara ett jobb!**

Oavsett vilken roll du söker kommer vi att ge dig verktygen och stödet du behöver för att växa – både som yrkesperson och individ. Vi erbjuder dig nästa stora möjlighet i ett kreativt, motiverande och välkomnande företag där alla kan vara sig själva och har lika möjligheter. Vi respekterar och värdesätter mångfald. Förutom en attraktiv och inkluderande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi även flexibilitet samt ett brett utbud av förmåner.


**Ansök och bli en del av oss!**

Om du är intresserad av att bli en del av vårt team – tveka inte att ansöka! Placering för denna roll är Solna, Stockholm.


Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Talent Partner Christine Wilén på christine.wilen@teliacompany.com .


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! För att säkerställa att dina personuppgifter hanteras på ett säkert sätt ber vi dig att ansöka via vårt rekryteringssystem. Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot CV:n via e-post eller liknande.


Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Under processen kommer nödvändiga bakgrundskontroller att genomföras.


**Welcome to Telia – Join us and make better happen!**
