* Champion editorial standard processes by evolving curation policies, programming hypotheses, and strategic editorial approaches across diverse markets.
* Facilitate global alignment through structured communication rhythms — designing and leading workshops, hosting editorial forums, and enabling consistent collaboration among editorial teams.
* Track and report on program success using both qualitative and quantitative data, delivering narrative updates and insights to partners that inform future planning.
* Regularly review, refine and communicate editorial guidelines around cultural moments, curation principles, rapid response, and experimentation to ensure clarity, consistency, and strategic fit.
* Help develop and roll out onboarding materials and training resources to support editorial teams in adopting updated policies, tools, and global programs — ensuring new editors are equipped to contribute from day one.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong track record in project or program management, with 5+ years of experience in the music, media, or digital content space — ideally at a streaming service, record label, or editorial-focused company.
* You bring genuine enthusiasm for partnering with editors — helping them scale their work, innovate on formats, and bring culturally relevant initiatives to life.
* You are highly organized and strategic, able to turn broad creative goals into clear roadmaps, structured processes, and globally scalable solutions.
* You have exceptional partner management skills and excel at navigating cross-functional environments — building trust and alignment across editorial, marketing, PR, design, and audio/video production partners.
* You are data-literate and comfortable working with spreadsheets and analytics tools to extract insights, inform decisions, and report on program impact.
* You bring a high level of intercultural awareness, and are confident coordinating projects across time zones and local market dynamics.
* You’re an excellent communicator and compelling storyteller — skilled at distilling complex strategies and inspiring collaborators across subject areas.
* You are fluent in English, both spoken and written; fluency in additional languages is a plus, particularly those tied to key Spotify markets.
* You care deeply about equity, inclusion, and representation in music — and advocate for diverse voices in the programs you help deliver.
* You’re a self-starter, flexible in fast-changing environments, and capable of juggling multiple initiatives with ease.
* You’re fluent in project management tools and use them to bring clarity and momentum to every project.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in either Stockholm or London.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 2-3 times per week.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Junior Business Analyst (fixed-term)
company_industry: Biotechnology Research, Medical Equipment Manufacturing, and Research Services
description:
**Job Description Summary**
 As Junior Business Analyst you will work closely with the Senior Business Analyst for the Medication Delivery Solutions (MDS) Business Unit in providing business partnering solutions to the commercial teams and the Country Business Leader. You will report to the MDS Senior Business Analyst with a dotted line to the Country Business Leader.
   

  

 This role is a fixed term contract, ending 1st April 2026. We require a minimum of 4 days of in-office presence per week to maintain our culture of excellence and ensure smooth operations, while also recognizing the importance of flexibility and work-life balance.
   

  

 Our vision for Medical Delivery Solutions at BD
   

  

 In Medication Delivery Solutions (MDS), we aim to redefine care delivery for every person we touch by creating simpler, better and safer solutions. We help clinicians and healthcare stakeholders re-think vascular access care, optimize medication preparation, and deliver medications safely, in diverse patient populations and care settings.
   

  

**Job Description**
**We are the makers of possible**
 BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 A career at BD means learning and working alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. You will have the opportunity to help shape the trajectory of BD while leaving a legacy at the same time.
   

  

 To find purpose in the possibilities, we need people who can see the bigger picture, who understand the human story that underpins everything we do. We welcome people with the imagination and drive to help us reinvent the future of health. At BD, you’ll discover a culture in which you can learn, grow and thrive. And find satisfaction in doing your part to make the world a better place.
   

  

 Become a maker of possible with us!
   

  

**Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Support and learn forecasting and budgeting processes, ensuring all commitments are met accurately and timely
* Learn to become fluent in BPC (Business Planning and Consolidation) System and handle extensive reporting requirements with tight deadlines
* Analyze drivers of revenue and gross profit performance to support presentations for key meetings
* Collaborate with Marketing and Sales teams to support in setting appropriate territory targets and optimize profitability
* Support in identifying risks and opportunities, as well as keeping track of relevant tenders
* Support commercial teams with managing the BI landscape
* Ensure standardization and continuous improvement in processes, contributing to a strong Business Analyst team


**About You**
* Educated to degree level, preferably in finance or a related field.
* A first experience in revenue analysis or similar role with good knowledge of Excel is a must.
* Proficiency in English, Swedish is considered a big plus.
* Technologically savvy, ideally including understanding of BI tools (e.g. PowerBI)
* High level of flexibility and adaptability in changing and complex environments.
* Strong financial, critical thinking, and analytical skills.


 Click on apply if this sounds like you!
   

  

 At BD, we prioritize on-site collaboration because we believe it fosters creativity, innovation, and effective problem-solving, which are essential in the fast-paced healthcare industry. For most roles, we require a minimum of 4 days of in-office presence per week to maintain our culture of excellence and ensure smooth operations, while also recognizing the importance of flexibility and work-life balance.
   

  

 Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital or domestic or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, disability, military eligibility or veteran status, and other legally-protected characteristics.
   

  

 To learn more about BD visit: https://bd.com/careers
   

  

**Required Skills**
 Optional Skills
   

  

 Primary Work Location
   

  

 SWE Stockholm - Marieviksgatan
   

  

 Additional Locations
   

  

 Work Shift
   

  

 At BD, we are strongly committed to investing in our associates—their well-being and development, and in providing rewards and recognition opportunities that promote a performance-based culture. We demonstrate this commitment by offering a valuable, competitive package of compensation and benefits programs which you can learn more about on our Careers Site under Our Commitment to You.
   

  

 Salary or hourly rate ranges have been implemented to reward associates fairly and competitively, as well as to support recognition of associates’ progress, ranging from entry level to experts in their field, and talent mobility. There are many factors, such as location, that contribute to the range displayed.
   

  

 The salary or hourly rate offered to a successful candidate is determined by their experience, education, and skills, as well as the labor laws and Collective Bargaining Agreement (CBA) requirements applicable to the work location.
   

  

**Salary Range Information**
 kr370,900.00 - kr630,500.00 SEK Annual

title: Presales Consultant STRATA
description:
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
   

  

 Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
   

  

 Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Career**
 As a Presales Domain Consultant STRATA for network security transformation, you provide technical expertise and guidance in customers' network security and zero trust journey. You will be key in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives. You evangelize our industry leadership in on-prem, cloud, and security services that establish Palo Alto Networks as a customer’s cybersecurity partner.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Collaborate with sales teams to recommend and develop customer solutions within your assigned specialization
* Architect solutions that will help our customers strengthen and simplify their security posture
* Present to customers as our expert at all levels in the customer hierarchy, from practitioner to senior leadership
* Lead and support customer demonstrations that showcase our unique value proposition
* Responsible for prospective customers and partners' Technical Validation projects based on best practices to ensure technical win in assigned opportunities
* Document high-level design and key use cases to ensure proper implementation and value realization of Palo Alto Networks solutions
* Lead conversations about industry trends and emerging changes to the security landscape
* Responsible for discussing and highlighting product alignment with customer requirements and differentiation
* As the main technical point of contact for Network Security, you will assist and collaborate to respond effectively to RFIs/RFPs
* Position Palo Alto Networks or Partner delivered services as appropriate to ensure proper implementation and value realization of Palo Alto Networks solutions
* Discuss, with credibility, competitive offers in the marketplace and position ours as the best alternative


**Qualifications**
**Your Experience**
* Multiple years of specialist experience in pre-sales/sales engineering within one or more of the following specialisms - Zero Trust, SaaS Security, SSE/SASE, Networking or Network Security
* Being the expert addition to the technical sales function
* Solid understanding of NGFW, Network Security, SASE, SD-WAN, CASB, Proxy, DLP and BYOD Solutions
* Experience in working with customers, demonstrating problem-solving skills and a can-do attitude
* Business fluent in Swedish and English


**Additional Information**
**The Team**
 Our Domain Consultant team members work hand-in-hand with organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire,and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
   

  

 You are empowered with unmatched systems and tools and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. Our Solutions Consulting community is driven by the mission to be our customers’ cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting their digital way of life.
   

  

**Our Commitment**
 We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Process Engineer - DRIE
description:
Silex Microsystems is the world’s leading pure-play MEMS foundry, customizing solutions for prominent global clients in industries such as pharmaceuticals, consumer electronics, and automotive. As a Process Engineer, you will initiate and drive progress in the DRIE Area. Sounds interesting? Keep reading.
   

  

*Would you like to know more about Silex and what we do? Read more here.* 
  

  

 The Deep Reaction Ion Etching (DRIE) Area is a vital part of our production in MEMS-manufacturing, where the main focus is removing Silicon in a controlled way to create the structures of the MEMS-device. The DRIE systems utilizes RF-power to produce a plasma to create ions that are used to remove Silicon.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Your primary duties will include:
   

  

* Develop and optimize etching processes for MEMS manufacturing.
* Perform process characterization, troubleshooting, and optimization to meet quality and performance requirements.
* Manage development batches and handle production stoppages.
* Provide technical support and expertise to quickly resolve process-related issues.
* Work with the internal service team at Silex as well as with suppliers to ensure equipment stability.
* Collaborate with Product Managers to ensure customer requirements and delivery targets are met.


**We are looking for someone who have:**
* M.Sc in Engineering, Physics or a similar field.
* Written and verbal fluency in English.
* Experience with MEMS or CMOS manufacturing.
* A great eye for detail and structure to be able document test plans, test cases and results.
* Ability to communicate effectively with other engineers, product development teams and stakeholders.


 It is also beneficial if you:
   

  

* Have experience working in a clean room environment


**About Silex**
 Silex is the world’s largest and most advanced pure-play MEMS foundry, headquartered in Stockholm. MEMS technology is moving into an abundance of modern innovations; from data centers, consumer and automotive electronics to medical diagnostics and life science.
   

  

 With a team of expert engineers, operators, technicians, and specialists, Silex brings the ideas of the industry’s leading MEMS innovators to life. We collaborate with some of the world’s largest technology giants and visionary startups across industries such as medicine, life sciences, consumer electronics, telecommunications, automotive, and industrial sectors.
   

  

**More About The Recruitment Process**
 To apply, please attach your CV, or LinkedIn-profile, and answer a few brief questions. Our process is competency-based and includes a personality and logic test, reference checks, and a background check. Additionally, a drug test will be conducted prior to employment, and we perform random alcohol and drug tests for all employees.
   

  

 We look forward to your application and welcoming you to this exciting journey!
   

  

**Silex** 
 is the world’s largest and most advanced pure-play MEMS foundry. With a team of expert engineers, operators, technicians, engineers, support staff, specialists, and much more besides, Silex transforms the visionary ideas of the world’s leading MEMS innovators into reality.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
We’re looking for an experienced Business Development Manager to join our Bolt Business team in Sweden. You’ll drive our sales growth, reach out to businesses, meet clients, pitch, negotiate, and close deals for mid-sized businesses.
   

  

**About Us**
 With over 200 million users in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.
   

  

 We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or ability.
   

  

 Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars. And we need your help on this mission!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Business Development Manager, you'll have an in-depth understanding of SMB and SME clients, establish strong connections, and confidently demonstrate the features and benefits of our B2B offering.
   

  

 This role is a good match for you if you have sales experience in a fast-paced company and are keen to be part of a team responsible for amplifying Bolt Business's success and supporting our ambitious growth and expansion plans.
   

  

**Main tasks and responsibilities:**
* Managing the sales funnel, including processing leads, prospecting, cold calling, closing deals, and building up a well-balanced pipeline while ensuring qualitative top-of-funnel inputs and high conversion rates to meet the output goals.
* Setting up thought-through outreach strategies to establish strong customer relationships with medium businesses and ensuring the successful completion of newly acquired deals.
* Achieving growth and hitting sales targets (leveraging the benefits of an uncapped commission scheme) by implementing effective strategies, identifying and targeting potential customers, and analysing and optimising performance.
* Sharing regular updates on the overall business progress and successes with the management team.
* Providing market feedback to the Product team and playing an essential role in developing our solutions based on businesses' needs.
* Monitoring emerging markets, identifying new opportunities, and promptly responding to market shifts and challenges by removing existing obstacles.


**About you:**
* You have at least 3 years of experience in fast-paced B2B sales, with strong professional expertise in selling business services to SMEs and mid-sized businesses. Having a degree is advantageous.
* You’re passionate about sales and consistently achieve ambitious targets, driven by a results-oriented mindset and a commitment to exceeding expectations.
* You have a proven track record of sourcing and successfully closing mid-market clients and excel in driving revenue growth.
* You can effectively communicate in English and the local language, efficiently network, and build meaningful relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* You demonstrate a highly data-driven, analytical mindset and are an experienced CRM user (preferably Salesforce) who can examine data to optimise your activities.
* Your hands-on work demonstrates a high level of initiative in actively seeking solutions to challenges and a strong sense of ownership.


 Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying!
   

  

**Why you’ll love it here:**
* Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
* Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
* Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
* Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
* Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
* Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 3 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.
* Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
* Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.

title: Head of Accounting
description:
My client, an expanding global business, is seeking an experienced Head of Accounting to join its team in Kista.
 



  





 Managing a small team, we are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented professional as the new Head of Accounting.
 



  





 In this role, you will be responsible for a broad range of financial and Accounting functions, ensuring alignment with group policies and regulatory standards.
 



  





 Key responsibilities of the Head of Accounting include:
 



 Developing and implementing Accounting and financial policies in line with group guidelines
 



 Supporting the preparation of financial statements and balance sheets through effective data collection and analysis
 



 Leading year-end audit processes and ensuring accurate and timely reporting
 



 Managing internal controls to safeguard financial integrity
 



 Overseeing and managing major contracts to ensure compliance and efficiency
 



 Ensuring full compliance with all relevant financial and tax regulations
 



 Providing leadership and guidance to your team, fostering a collaborative and high- performing environment
 



 Managing day-to-day Accounting transactions and postings
 



 Preparing accruals and year-end provisions
 



 Overseeing fixed asset management processes
 



 Collaborating with IT to develop and maintain SAP systems and enhance financial processes
 



  





 Essential requirements:
 



 Degree in Finance/Accounting
 



 Fluent in Swedish
 



 10 years' experience in an Accounting role
 



 Strong knowledge of SAP and Excel
 



  





 EMEA Recruitment is committed to promoting Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion in the workplace. We act as a neutral third party in the recruitment process, basing our candidate searches on skills and experience. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, sex, relationship status, disability, race, religion/beliefs, or sexual orientation.
 







 Due to the high volume of applications we receive, we’re only able to contact those selected for the next stage of the process. If you haven’t heard from us within five working days, unfortunately your application has not been successful. Please continue to explore future opportunities at www.emearecruitment.com

title: Director Consulting Services – Retail, Stockholm
description:
As a Director Consulting Services, you will play a crucial role by focusing on our most valuable assets: our clients, our business, and our employees. You will work with multiple existing clients within the Retail sector, while also being responsible for developing existing and new business opportunities. You will be an essential part of CGI's continued growth journey, with significant opportunities to influence both your own and your team's career development. Additionally, you will be a member of the management team within the unit focusing on Retail, where you will actively contribute to the operational, tactical, and strategic development of the unit.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with strong experience in Service Delivery, Business Consulting and System development, who also has a strong passion for business development. We believe that you have an extensive network within IT and industry sectors and are experienced in engaging with clients to understand their challenges and opportunities in both digitalization and business development.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 As a Director Consulting Services, you will be responsible for the group's growth, financial performance, capacity planning, and competency development. You will have profit and budget responsibility for your clients and the employees within your team.
   

  

 One of your key challenges will be to drive aggressive growth targets for the group, with a focus on the following areas:
   

  

* Business Development – Act as a strategic advisor to our clients, aiming to deepen partnerships and open new business opportunities.
* Leadership – Lead, develop, and motivate your employees to achieve both their personal goals and CGI’s objectives. Your team will consist of approximately 15–20 employees.
* Recruitment – Attract, retain, and recruit new talent to expand your team.
* Operational Management – Ensure the achievement of revenue, profitability, and growth targets in alignment with the team's roadmap and growth plan.
* Industry Expertise – Stay updated on developments within System Development and the Retail sector to maintain a leading advisory role within CGI in these areas.
* Management Team Collaboration – Actively participate in the management team to develop the unit and maintain our commitment to being a world-class team.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 We are looking for someone who enjoys developing both business and client relationships. You are driven by identifying new business opportunities that create value for clients. Your experience in Retail, Business Consulting, and IT enables you to easily understand technology and discuss client needs, linking them to our services and strategic competency development for our employees.
   

  

 As a person, you are highly motivated and thrives in a progressive and change-driven environment. You are a leader who motivates and engages your employees, with a positive and communicative attitude, as well as the determination to develop both the business and your team.
   

  

 We offer you a challenging and rewarding role, where you will have the responsibility to drive the growth of your team and unit, alongside a fantastic group of colleagues and leaders.
   

  

**Want to Learn More?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Applications will be reviewed continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline. Please feel free to send your inquiries to: Bodil Oscarsson, bodil.oscarsson@cgi.com
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Erfaren IT-infrastrukturspecialist till globalt företag
description:
Till vår kund i centrala Stockholm söker vi en erfaren och engagerad IT-infrastrukturspecialist som vill arbeta med drift och förvaltning av en stabil och affärskritisk IT-miljö tillsammans med ett sammansvetsat infrastrukturteam. Här får du en nyckelroll där du arbetar brett med serverhantering, nätverk och säkerhet i en miljö som ständigt utvecklas.
   

  

 Tjänsten börjar som ett konsultuppdrag via Centric, och efter sex månader kommer anställningen att övergå direkt till kunden. Detta är en utmärkt möjlighet för dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra med din expertis i en internationell organisation med långsiktigt fokus på tillförlitlig IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantering av virtuella maskiner (implementering, förvaltning och avveckling) i VMware- och Nutanix-miljö
* Hantering av Windows servermiljön (onprem)
* Felsökning och drift av Cisco LAN och trådlösa nätverk
* Leda och delta i projekt
* Hantering av brandväggsregler och ständigt förbättra säkerheten i våra miljöer
* Självständigt och tillsammans med andra lokala och globala team vara drivande i att utveckla befintlig miljö och implementera nya system
* Incidenthantering
* Stötta verksamheten vid implementering och uppgradering av verksamhetssystem


**Din Profil Och KvalifikationerKrav**
* Minst 4-6 års yrkeserfarenhet inom relevanta områden
* Relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning och CCNA eller motsvarande kunskap
* Erfarenhet av drift och underhåll av nätverk, Windows serverar, Active Directory, GPO och VMware
* Scripting kunskaper
* Flytande i tal och skrift i både svenska och engelska


*Det är meriterande om du har gått kurser eller innehar certifikat från VMware, Nutanix, Microsoft, Cisco och ITIL.*
**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Project Manager - Board Design
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Overall responsible for Radio Board Design, a core product within Ericsson and leading the development team, who makes it happen. A key role and key position interacting with major design disciplines and leading a diverse engineering team with global cooperation.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Product development and release of board design
* Planning and coordination of complex technical area across the board design
* Manage dependency towards internal stakeholders
* Manage dependency for industrialization of board design
* Manage resource management, Escaltion and Coordination across sites
* Flow optimization, knowledge transfer and learning


**Skills you Bring:**
* A Master’s degree in a relevant field
* Strong passion for collaboration, teamwork, and building effective relationships
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* Genuine interest in technology and innovative technical solutions
* The confidence to challenge ideas constructively and contribute to continuous improvement
* The ability to inspire and motivate others
* Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
* Solid understanding of project management principles
* Proven skills in planning, coordination, and execution
* A proactive, action-oriented mindset (“get-it-done” attitude)
* Ability to remain calm and focused under pressure
* Adaptability and resilience in times of change

title: Senior Packaging Manager
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
***Karo Healthcare***
*, a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.*




 Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a
 **Packaging Manager** 
 for our office in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   




**What's in it for you?**

 A hands-on role with real impact. Join a fast-growing international company where packaging plays a vital role in innovation, sustainability, and brand experience. You'll collaborate across markets, contribute to product launches, and shape packaging strategies that reach millions. If you thrive in fast-moving environments and want to grow your career globally—this is your opportunity.
   




**What you'll be doing**
* Drive the technical execution of packaging tasks across our portfolio, ensuring alignment with Karo's packaging strategy
* Provide cross-functional technical support that delivers measurable value
* Own and create finished goods and component specifications, securing functionality, sustainability, and aesthetic appeal
* Lead packaging input within New Product Development (NPD) teams, including briefs for costing and innovation insight
* Conduct packaging tests, functionality assessments, and dimensional analyses
* Develop and approve defect classifications, standards, and visual range boards
* Align testing protocols with contract manufacturers (CMOs) and packaging suppliers
* Maintain packaging specs in our systems, including technical drawings and BOMs
* Ensure packaging quality throughout the full distribution chain, including last-mile delivery
* Act as key user for our packaging specification platforms, supporting systems implementation and improvements
  

  


**Requirements**
* Minimum 8 years' experience in Packaging Development or Procurement, ideally within FMCG, consumer health, or adjacent fast-paced industries
* University degree in a scientific or engineering field
* Proven ability to interpret and assess risks from technical data
* Strong communicator—able to adapt complex technical details to different stakeholders
* Demonstrated alignment with Karo's core values and collaborative culture
  

  


**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule, hybrid model with the primary work place in the office, and life-work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a dynamic, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values



   
 



*Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.*

title: Data Engineer (Databricks)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 800 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!
 



  





**Your role** 




 As a Data Engineer with a Databricks focus, you will be building scalable and secure data platforms. You will leverage your expertise in Databricks, Apache Spark, as well as Azure to design, develop, and implement data warehouses, data lakehouses, and AI/ML models that fuel our data-driven operations.
 



  





*In this role you will play a key part in:* 



* Designing and building high-performance data pipelines: Utilize Databricks and Apache Spark to extract, transform, and load data into Azure Data Lake Storage and other Azure services.
* Develop and maintain secure data warehouses and data lakehouses: Implement data models, data quality checks, and governance practices to ensure reliable and accurate data.
* Building and deploying AI/ML models: Integrate Machine Learning into data pipelines, leverage Databricks ML and Azure ML to develop predictive models and drive business insights.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with business analysts, data scientists, and DevOps engineers to ensure successful data platform implementations.



  





**Your profile** 



* Professional experience of working with Data Engineering
* Fluent Swedish skills - you have the ability to communicate in a professional context
* Proven expertise in Databricks, Apache Spark, and data pipeline development and strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and practices.
* Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud platform, including Azure Data Lake Storage, Databricks, and Azure Data Factory.
* Knowledge of SQL and scripting languages like Python and hands-on experience with AI/ML concepts and tools.



  





**What we believe you will enjoy about working here** 



* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We partner with names such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Databricks, which can equip you with valuable certifications in the latest technologies in line with your ambitions.



  





**Your Application** 




*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.* 




  





 Welcome to apply!
 



  





**About Capgemini** 




 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
 



  





**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Data Warehouse Expert
description:
Are you skilled in data warehouse, data engineering and ready for new challenges? We are looking for consultants to join our Financial Services team in Stockholm.
   

  

 As an consultant at CGI, you are offered a global arena with the opportunity to take your career to next step within data and insights.
   

  

 We at CGI believe in the idea that we can go further if we thrive and work together. Our breadth of assignments and colleagues creates an optimal environment to grow and develop; both as a team and as individuals. Every day we build each other, our clients and our business.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 Working as a data warehouse/data engineering expert at CGI means a varied everyday life. Here you are offered the opportunity to develop as a consultant both in local customer deliveries and in major global commitments. You can work in small, short projects a few months to large long commitments. We participate in and run projects and commitments on site at our client´s offices, but mainly from our local offices. We work both individually and together with other colleagues in our projects. Our assignments are carried out with the support of established methods and models based on industry standards.
   

  

 As a data warehouse expert, you will be responsible for bringing expertise in data modeling and data engineering. You will be part of a team that delivers solutions to our major clients in the financial services sector. You will independently engage with expert stakeholders at Sweden's top-tier banks and insurance companies to solve their most demanding challenges. Your role will involve solving complex digital initiatives, facilitating the decision-making process, and quickly finding solutions to emerging obstacles. Your deliverables will require close collaboration with highly skilled, multidisciplinary teams spread across different geographies.
   

  

**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 To succeed in this role, we are looking for someone with a strong drive and a client-focused
   

  

 mindset. You have experience in data and solution creation and are used to working in complex environments. Additionally, you hold an academic degree in computer science, technology, or engineering.
   

  

 We want you to have experience from / within:
   

  

* Design and implement advanced Data Warehouse solutions that enable agile data modeling and analysis
* Data architecture
* Optimization and management of data flows to ensure high availability and performance. Design/develop ETL
* Drive the transition to and an understanding of Cloud Architecture for designing robust solutions that incorporate technology, strategy, culture, and processes
* Data Migration experience – Teradata/Oracle/SQL Server or Hadoop workloads to cloud DWH (Snowflake/RedShift/Big Query)
* IT Application Support
* Strong technical team leadership mentorship and collaboration


****What You Can Expect Fom Us****
 CGI's combination of global and local presence, with offices in more than 28 locations in Sweden, provides satisfied clients and also means that you as an employee always have an office near you.
   

  

 At CGI, there are also great opportunities for internal career paths where you can choose to become a specialist in your field, broaden yourself in new areas or take a senior position. Through our internal networks, projects and commitments in global and national industries, we offer you competence development and committed leaders who support you in your development.
   

  

**Want to know more?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! If there is still something you are wondering about, feel free to contact Vishal Khaparde, vishal.khaparde@cgi.com. Good Luck!
   

  

**CGI**
 CGI is leading the digitalisation of Sweden and is a world leader in transforming innovation, information and technology. Through deep industry knowledge and an understanding of the client's challenges, we contribute insights to create sustainable results. We are located in 40 countries with 76,000 employees. In Sweden, our 4,000 employees are located in 30 locations with headquarters in Stockholm. Read more about CGI on our website: www.cgi.se.
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Global Head of Offensive Security
description:
***Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats?
   

  

 We are looking for a Global Head of Offensive Security to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Offensive Security domain.***
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Global Head of Offensive Security who wants to make a difference in our Offensive Security Team.
   

  

**Offensive Security**
 Our offensive team works proactively, helping organizations and companies protect themselves against cyber breaches by identifying vulnerabilities before they are exploited. Our devoted team members work closely together, utilizing their combined knowledge and experience to successfully perform assignments such as penetration tests, security assessments, and red team engagements.
   

  

**The Role**
 As the Global Head of Offensive Security, you will lead and develop our Offensive Security team, ensuring we stay ahead in the fight against cybercrime. Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Managing strategic customer relations, including negotiations and contracting.
* Coaching and supporting your international team of 20+ members.
* Helping the organization develop processes and routines for quality control and continued growth.
* Grow your business area in the countries following the global growth of Truesec group.
* Being a sounding board for both consultants and customers.
* Collaborating with recruiters to find grow the ranks of expert-level members for your team.
* Working with Business Development to create new services and offerings for our customers.
* Maintaining structure with deals, agreements, and procurement.


**Your Potential Background**
 We believe you have a background that includes extensive experience in offensive security and leadership from senior positions. Preferably, you have experience from a similar role within cybersecurity or at minimum within a technical IT organization.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Proven track record of leading high-performing teams in cybersecurity or similar areas.
* A good knowledge of tools, techniques, and methodologies used in offensive security.
* Excellent communication skills, both technical and non-technical.


**Bonus Skills:**
* Extensive experience in penetration testing and red teaming.
* Certifications such as OSCP, OSCE, or similar.
* Experience in public speaking or thought leadership in cybersecurity.
* Familiarity with defensive security measures and incident response.
* Experience in growth journeys, with entrepreneurial traits being a big plus.


 Above all, we believe you are just as passionate about cybersecurity as we are! Every day, we work with preventing intrusions and cybercrimes with the ultimate goal of making Sweden and the world safer. By joining forces with us at Truesec, you get to work with the best in the business to continue this mission!
   

  

***Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.***
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Customer Success Manager - Supply Chain/Forecasting/Purchasing
description:
**EazyStock**
 EazyStock’s parent company, Syncron, has been specialising in Inventory and Price solutions for enterprise customers for 30years. With customers such as JCB, Mazda and Manitowoc, Syncron is a market leader in their field.
   

  

 EazyStock was set up as a cloud-based forecasting, purchasing and inventory optimisation tool, with the goals of helping customers reduce stock, increase service level, provide dynamic categorisation, and give easily accessible KPI information.
   

  

 We are an entrepreneurial and international team, operating across Europe, Asia, and the USA, developing and selling the best cloud-based inventory optimization solution on the market.
   

  

 The software is best in class, but it is our people that make us special. We hire great people, give them the tools, and then help them to flourish. We are a customer first business who achieve our goals together.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Customer Success Manager (CSM) is the face of the company. It is an exciting and broad role that includes both heading up the implementation of new customers, and providing their long-term guidance to ensure they meet their goals. It is about taking responsibility for your allocated customers and becoming a part of their business. We want you to know what they do, how they do it and how EazyStock can best add long-term value.
   

  

 The CSM is the voice of the customer within the business. Whether this be product development, process improvements or support requirements, you will work cross functionally to ensure needs are met and you will play a major role in how the region evolves to further support their customers.
   

  

 What would you do?
   

  

  

* Attend, contribute to, and eventually lead Discovery Workshops with customers.
* Map customer requirements to EazyStock capabilities.
* Provide user training.
* Hold regular value reviews with all of your customers to ensure they are meeting their goals, understand if their needs are changing and set value targets for upcoming periods.
* Identify functionality gaps, scope solutions, and liaise with Products Team to ensure appropriate development for your customers.
* Potentially create SQL reports to support specific testing use cases.


 Who you are? / What we expect:
   

  

  

* Some demonstrable working experience in at least one of Supply Chain, Purchasing or Forecasting.
* Business English proficient. With evidence of tailoring both verbal and written communication to achieve desired results.
* Clear and concise presentation skills, ability to adapt message depending on audience.
* Ability to teach, train and coach users through their EazyStock journey, identifying different learning methods and adapting your training.
* Desire and ability to keep up to date with news/issues/advancements in technology related to the domain.
* Experience using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook (or equivalents) in a business environment.
* Business level language skills in English and Swedish


 The icing on the cake:
   

  

  

* Project Management Experience (particularly in Software).
* Experience in a cloud SaaS organisation.
* Experience with cloud Software implementations.
* Customer Success/Account Management experience.


 We offer:
   

  

  

* Structured onboarding training plan.
* Genuinely flexible hybrid working
* Career Progression Model and clear guidance on development, with Customer Success and Management paths to choose from.


**Unsure** 
 if you meet all the job requirements but passionate about the role?
 **Apply anyway!** 
 Syncron values diversity and welcomes all Candidates,
 **even** 
 those with non-traditional backgrounds. We believe in transferable skills and a shared passion for success!
   

  

 The world is changing. Manufacturing companies are shifting from selling products to delivering services. And we are driving this transformation together with our Customers, by helping them reduce costs and manual processes. We are guiding them on their journey towards a fully connected service experience and making their brand stronger.
   

  

**Our go** 
**al: to make the complex simple.**
 Visit syncron.com to get to know us better!
   

  

 If you encounter any case of potential ethical or laws violations, you may submit a report to a dedicated Syncron Whistleblowing Platform here.
   

  

 You may request Syncron Whistleblowing Procedure via the „ask a question” tab available here.

title: AI Artist
description:
**About Us**
 At Klarna, our mission is to smooth commerce and make it easier and safer for people to shop and pay for their purchases. With our focus on customer obsession and commitment to transparency and accountability at the heart of everything we do, we are proud to be a trusted partner to 85 million consumers and 575,000 retailers across 45 markets.
   

  

 Our amazing talented people and innovative technologies enable us to deliver this mission and we believe that we are making a positive impact on society and helping to drive the global economy forward.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Klarna is seeking a talented and innovative AI Creative Specialist to join the Brand Domain and our dynamic Motion and Image production team. This unique role is designed for an individual who is passionate about blending the art of design with the power of AI technology. As an AI Creative Specialist, you will be responsible for creating visually stunning and commercially effective imagery using a combination of advanced AI tools and Adobe products. Your work will play a crucial role in shaping Klarna's brand identity and marketing campaigns.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Creative Conceptualization and explorations: Collaborate with the brand design and campaign teams to translate ideas into compelling visual narratives.
* AI-Driven Image Production: AI prompt engineering to craft effective and innovative prompts that align with creative goals and critically analyze AI outputs and iterate efficiently to refine results.
* Explore and experiment with new AI technologies to stay ahead of industry trends in AI-driven design.
* Advanced Retouching: Apply expert-level skills in Adobe Photoshop for professional image retouching and image manipulation. Ensure all visual content aligns with Klarna's brand standards and aesthetic.
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously, from exploring concepts through to production and completion of images, estimate the time needed for each project to ensure timely and high-quality deliveries.


**Who You Are**
* You have excellent communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working closely with Team Leads, Brand & Project Managers, Art Directors, Designers and Legal Teams.
* You have proven experience in ai image production and professional image retouching and have a strong portfolio showcasing a blend of technical skill and creativity within positive restraints (such as working within established guidelines).
* You have advanced proficiency in Adobe Photoshop and familiarity with other Adobe Creative Suite products.
* You are familiar with some of the leading AI image generating tools such as: Adobe Firefly, Midjourney, DALL-E, Leonardo, KREA or similar.
* You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education in Photography, Visual Arts or a related field is preferred.
* Background or experience in Art Direction and/or Photography is a plus.


**Application Process**
 Interested candidates should submit a resume, a cover letter, and a portfolio demonstrating both creative and technical work. The portfolio should particularly highlight AI-generated imagery and advanced retouching skills.
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Location: This is an on-site position at Klarna HQ in Stockholm.
* Team Environment: We thrive in a fast-paced environment with high creative bandwidth. Innovation is rewarded!


 Join us at Klarna and contribute to shaping the future of AI-driven creative production. If you're a creative with a passion for AI, tech and innovation, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

****Closing****
 To ensure fairness and maintain global market competitiveness, each role in a specific location has a set base salary. During the recruitment process, we will assess your skills and experience to determine which role is the best fit for you.
   

  

 Additionally, you may qualify for our Contribution-Based Reward (CBR) program, which recognizes and rewards significant contributions to our success.
   

  

**Total Compensation**
 Please include a CV in English.
   

  

 Since 2005, Klarna has been on a mission to reimagine how consumers spend and save in their daily lives. We help people save time and money and reduce financial worry. With over 85 million global active users and 2.5 million transactions per day, our vision is a world where Klarna empowers everyone, everywhere, through seamless financial and commerce experiences—as a personalized, trusted assistant making financial empowerment effortless.
   

  

 Over 575,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store.

title: Leveranschef/Konsultchef
description:
**Hos oss på Advania Real Estate får du möjlighet att utveckla innovativa lösningar i molnet och skapa högkvalitativa IT-plattformar för både bygg- och fastighetsbranschen. Tillsammans löser vi tekniska utmaningar som skapar verklig verksamhetsnytta och driver branschen framåt.**
 Leveranschef/Konsultchef på Advania 🚀
   

  

 I rollen som Leverans- och konsultchef inom Advanias Real Estate ansvarar du för att leda ett team med seniora specialister inom teknik och fastighets IT som arbetar i leveransteam eller deltar i projekt.
   

  

 Du är ansvarig för att belägga konsulterna internt och externt samt skapa rätt förutsättningar för ett välmående team och en stark leverans gentemot Advanias kunder.
   

  

 Arbetet är omväxlande, och du behöver som ledare kunna anpassa dig snabbt och hantera utmaningar. Du har ett viktigt ansvar att både upprätthålla och utveckla verksamheten, och vi ser gärna att du är bekväm med att arbeta operativt, taktiskt och strategiskt.
   

  

 Rollen innefattar bland annat:
   

  

  

* Fullt personalansvar med lönesamtal, medarbetarsamtal med mera.
* Budgetansvar med affären i fokus.
* Ledningsgruppsarbete.
* Kapacitets- och resursplanering.
* Säkerställa en god beläggningsgrad.
* Säkerställa att teamet får rätt kompetensutveckling och coachning.
* Vara med i upphandlingar och affärer där din kompetens är ett behov.
* Ansvara för leveranser gentemot kund.
* Samarbeta med strategiska partners.
* Attrahera och rekrytera nya medarbetare.
* Integrera med övriga team och affärsområden för att stärka leverans och sammanhållning.


 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 För att du ska trivas och passa hos oss söker vi dig som har mångårig erfarenhet av att leda konsult-och leveransteam i sourcing/IT-branschen och har således god förståelse för IT-leverans. Du har erfarenhet av ledningsgrupparbete sedan ett flertal år och har tidigare haft fullt budgetansvar. Vidare har du ett starkt affärssinne och är van att vara med i kunddialoger. Som person är du bekväm med att vara obekväm, du är inte rädd för utmaningar eller att driva förändringar. Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av fastighetsbranschen.
   

  

 Vi värderar dina personliga egenskaper högt. För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är självgående, uthållig och entreprenöriell med ett starkt eget driv och en ansvarskänsla för både din och teamets utveckling. Du brinner för att bygga relationer med kollegor och kunder och har gärna ett etablerat nätverk för att kunna attrahera nya talanger till teamet. Du har också en god affärsförståelse och är van vid att arbeta med måluppföljning, ekonomiska resultat, kvalitetssäkring och kundnöjdhet.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Advania med Level Recruitment. Vid frågor, vänligen kontakta ansvarig Senior Rekryteringskonsult Lynn Sjöberg Westander 08-120 50 431. Urvalet av ansökningar sker löpande.
   

  

 Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
   

  

 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
   

  

 Det är du som arbetar nära kunden som vet vad dem behöver och vad som blir den bästa lösningen för just deras unika behov, både i dag och i morgon. Därför tycker vi att det är du som ska fatta besluten. Det är genom att erbjuda säkra, hållbara och kundanpassade lösningar som vi skapar värde för kunderna och samhället i stort.
   

  

 Vi bryr oss om hur våra medarbetare mår – på riktigt. Därför samarbetar Advania med Ljung & Sjöberg för att skapa en trygg, proaktiv arbetsmiljö med stöd kring alkohol-, drog- och beroenderelaterade frågor. Tillsammans bygger vi en hållbar arbetsplats där det är okej att be om hjälp, och där förebyggande arbete gör skillnad – för individen, teamet och företaget.
   

  

 I en miljö präglad av stort kundfokus och frihet under ansvar blir det extra viktigt för oss att bygga starka team bestående av ödmjuka stjärnor. Att arbeta i en inkluderande miljö, med kollegor och kunder som vill utvecklas, ger oss möjligheten att trivas och ha riktigt roligt på jobbet. Vi tror på en platt organisation med agilt arbetssätt och flexibilitet. Detta är det enda sättet för en hållbar framtid.
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.

title: Business Analyst inom försäkring
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 På CGI ligger vi i framkant när det kommer till digitalisering och tillämpning av nya teknologier. Just nu söker vi medarbetare som delar vår passion och som har en erfarenhet inom affärsutveckling.
   

  

 Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren Business Analyst med teknisk bakgrund inom Försäkring som kommer att fortsätta leda framgångsrika projekt för våra kunder, samtidigt som du stärker vårt team med dina erfarenheter och insikter.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som Business Analyst kommer du att ha en central roll i att stödja och utveckla våra IT-projekt och verksamhetsprojekt inom försäkringsbranschen. Din roll kommer att vara starkt kundinriktad, där du analyserar affärsbehov och formar skräddarsydda lösningar för att uppfylla deras krav.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Du är en initiativtagande person som trivs i en snabbväxande miljö. Som en del av vårt team förväntas du vara självgående men samtidigt en lagspelare. Du har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och en naturlig fallenhet för problemlösning.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har en bakgrund inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller liknande och har mellan 3-5 års erfarenhet inom försäkringsbranschen. Vidare har du god kännedom kring regelverken som styr försäkringsbolagens verksamhet (tex DORA, FIDA). Du har arbetat med databaser eller ETL-processer och är väl bevandrad inom SAFe.
   

  

**Det är extra meriterande om du har kunskap eller erfarenhet av följande teknologier**
* Generative AI /automation
* AI/RPA
* DataManagement / strategy
* Core insurance lösningar som tex Lumera, Sapiens Guidewire


 Om du söker dig till en arbetsplats som utmanar, utvecklar och hjälper dig vidare i din professionella karriär så är CGI rätt plats för dig. Ansök nu för att utforska möjligheten att vara en del av vårt spännande team inom Försäkringar!
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Susann Edvardsson på Susann.Edvardsson@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Konsult/Interim Business Systems Manager Stockholm
description:
**Vi söker nu för kunds räkning inom medtechbranschen en Business Systems Manager för ett längre uppdrag i Stockholm!**
 I detta uppdrag får du möjlighet att bidra med din tekniska kompetens inom ERP-systemet NetSuite och affärskritiska IT-lösningar i ett modernt bolag på en tillväxtresa. Du kliver in i en central roll där du stärker den interna IT-kompetensen och bidrar till att effektivisera viktiga verksamhetsflöden. Uppdraget är på heltid, med start efter sommaren och förväntas pågå en längre period framåt.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 I detta uppdrag kommer du att ha en central roll i att ta ett helhetsgrepp kring kundens ERP-system (NetSuite) och affärskritiska IT-lösningar i en modern och positiv företagsmiljö. Du blir ett viktigt stöd för verksamheten i att utveckla och nyttja NetSuite ERP. Du bidrar med administration, användarstöd, mallar och konfigurering av systemet samt arbetar för att stärka den interna kompetensen.
   

  

 Du arbetar även med administration av M365-miljö samt hantering av IT-infrastrukturen. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med verksamheten där din förmåga att förklara system och lösningar på ett pedagogiskt sätt blir värdefull.
   

  

**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Administrerar och utvecklar NetSuite ERP
* Stödjer användare med hur-frågor och problemlösning kring ERP och affärssystem
* Skapar mallar, dokumentation och guider för bättre användning av systemen
* Arbetar med administration av M365-miljön och IT-infrastrukturen
* Delar med dig av din kunskap och stärker teamets interna förmåga


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir en del av ett litet men engagerat IT-team där alla hjälps åt och tar ett brett ansvar för både klassisk IT och affärskritiska system. Kulturen präglas av framåtanda, nyfikenhet och positiv energi. Uppdraget utgår från kundens kontor i Stockholm med viss möjlighet till remote arbete.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Erfarenhet av ERP-system, gärna NetSuite
* God kunskap inom M365-administration
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta nära verksamheten


 Vi ser gärna att du är kommunikativ, pedagogisk och lösningsorienterad. Du trivs i en roll där du får stötta och vägleda andra, och du har en förmåga att förklara komplexa system på ett enkelt sätt. Vidare har du en akademisk examen inom data, mjukvara, IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet och kan kommunicera väl på svenska och engelska. Meriterande är om du även har erfarenhet av Salesforce CRM, Power BI, Azure eller andra SaaS-lösningar.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du är tillgänglig efter sommaren, men om du är tillgänglig längre fram kan det ändå vara aktuellt om det är rätt match. Om inte annat så tar vi gärna emot din ansökan och håller kontakten för framtida uppdrag!
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Country Lead | Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
**Job description**
**What We Do**
 Amsterdam Data Collective (ADC) is an AI Transformations partner for its clients, driving the responsible adoption of data and AI to create real impact for organisations. We support our clients in achieving their goals through data-driven solutions across multiple industries.
   

  

 ADC is a leading European data and AI consultancy that empowers organisations to harness the full potential of data and artificial intelligence in a responsible, pragmatic, and impactful way. With a mission to accelerate the positive and responsible adoption of data and AI, ADC provides strategic advisory and bespoke, end-to-end solutions to clients across various sectors, including financial services, life sciences, healthcare, the public sector, agriculture, and retail.
   

  

 The firm’s multidisciplinary expertise spans the entire data value chain:
   

  

**Data Strategy** 
 – Crafting actionable, business-aligned data and AI roadmaps
   

  

**Data Engineering** 
 – Designing secure, scalable, and future-proof data architectures
   

  

**Analytics & Data Science** 
 – Building AI-powered tools and predictive models that solve real-world problems
   

  

**Design & Visualisation** 
 – Through its in-house studio, CLEVER°FRANKE, creating intuitive, data-driven user experiences that bring complex insights to life
   

  

**Put ADC on the map - where strategy, data, and impact meet**
 At ADC, we’re not just consultants - we build with our clients. We work side by side, establishing lasting partnerships, blending technical depth with commercial sharpness to deliver real impact in Data & AI.
 **We’re scaling up in Sweden - and we need a Country Lead who’s ready to make waves.**
 This isn’t just another role - it’s a unique opportunity to accelerate and shape a growing practice, with the freedom to leave a mark for someone who combines
 ***deep knowledge of Data & AI* 
 ,
 *an entrepreneurial mindset* 
 , and
 *strong business development instincts* 
 .** 
 You’ll lead our presence in Sweden: building technical offerings aligned with global capabilities, securing high-impact projects, and anchoring ADC as the go-to consultancy for AI Transformations in the region.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with our global teams, represent us in the local ecosystem, and create the momentum needed to grow our presence.
   

  

 If you’re a technical leader with a strong quantitative foundation, a can-do mindset, and a passion for consultancy, we’d love to meet you!
   

  

**What You Do**
**Shape a market-leading Data & AI offering**
* Lead the development of our Data & AI services for the Swedish market - shaping new offerings, connecting to global capabilities, and setting a high technical bar.
* Help build our reputation in the Swedish market as a go-to partner for AI transformation and complex, quantitative challenges.
* Play a key role in our build-and-buy growth strategy by contributing to M&A conversations, identifying potential partnerships or acquisitions that could strengthen our local presence.
* Lead high-impact Data & AI projects end-to-end, turning complexity into clarity and value for clients through sharp solutions and trusted partnership.
* Stay close to trends in AI, data engineering, and advanced analytics to evolve our approach and anticipate client needs.
* Spot opportunities to showcase bold technical work through use cases, events, guest lectures or collaborations.


**Lead strategic growth and lasting impact**
* Take ownership of our go-to-market strategy in Sweden - refine our positioning, open new doors, and ensure we grow in the right direction.
* Bring in new projects across multiple sectors like Financial Services, Tech, and Life Sciences.
* Combine strategic vision with a hands-on approach: from shaping the go-to-market strategy to actively engaging in client conversations and driving day-to-day commercial initiatives.
* Work closely with teams to represent ADC in client conversations, shaping how we sell and deliver technical excellence.


***Lead locally, connect globally***
* Act as a sparring partner to both clients and consultants, balancing strategy and execution.
* Build and nurture a strong local network of industry leaders, academics, and innovators.
* Bridge our Swedish team with the global ADC teams - bringing in best practices, sharing knowledge, aligning approaches, and amplifying impact.


**What You Bring**
 At ADC, we believe that no one succeeds alone; we grow by challenging and supporting each other. We’re looking for a sharp, curious leader who combines strategic vision with technical depth, and a strong dose of entrepreneurial drive
   

  

* 6+ years of experience in Data, AI, or advanced analytics - ideally in consulting, innovation, or project-based environments.
* Strong quantitative background (e.g. Data Science, Econometrics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning & AI, Physics).
* A proven track record of shaping and delivering Data & AI solutions with clients.
* Commercial sharpness - you know how to identify opportunities and convert them into impactful work.
* A solid understanding of the Swedish market and an existing network in tech, business, or academia.
* Entrepreneurial drive - you’re someone who sees possibilities and makes them happen.
* Excellent communication skills - you move comfortably between technical and business audiences.
* A proactive, hands-on mindset - you thrive in building environments and bring others along.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


**What We Offer**
 At ADC, we don’t just offer jobs - we offer growth, impact, and a sense of belonging. We empower you to take ownership, build something meaningful, and thrive collectively.
   

  

* Help shape the next chapter of ADC in Sweden, with a high level of ownership and visibility.
* Build your own path, with leadership drive as we scale.
* A steep learning curve - take on responsibility from day one and grow into a trusted advisor, specialist, or ADC leader.
* Projects that make an impact - where you’ll tackle real-world challenges and drive meaningful change.
* Freedom to innovate - bring your ideas to life and help shape the future of risk management.
* Ongoing learning & development - with peer groups, project presentations, mentorship programs and Collective Lunch Sharing Sessions.
* Our Collective Week - a workation with the entire ADC team, where we collaborate on pro bono projects and create unforgettable memories.
* A competitive salary with a collective bonus structure - because we believe in rewarding success as a team.
* For those who shape our future, there’s a chance to own a part of it - investment opportunities are available because we believe in building with those who help us grow!
* A vibrant social culture - with Friday drinks, sports activities, and more... because work should be fun, too!


 At ADC, we believe in building with heart—where people, ethics, and impact come first. Ready to join us?
   

  

**What To Do Next**
 If you are inspired by the above, apply through the link below! For questions, contact amira.m@adc-consulting.com.

title: Cloud Sales Specialist - Nordics
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: Computer and Network Security, Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Why Join Us?
