* Troubleshoot and resolve issues across the content supply chain


****Experience Required****
* 10+ years of experience in driving Operations for large organizations
* At least 6 years of direct management experience, including leading teams of 20 or more
* Experience managing teams in the e-commerce or technology/internet space
* Proven ability to set and execute content or operational strategy to drive business results
* Strong analytical skills and data-driven decision-making; SQL expertise a plus

title: Sales Manager – Norway
description:
**Aurora Live by Management Events** 
 is the leading B2B growth partner for technology and management service providers, giving direct access to top decision-makers at the largest, most influential companies. Through our exclusive matchmaking services, we help commercial teams shorten sales cycles, accelerate sales flow, and build lasting customer relationships. Trusted by over 10,000 senior IT decision makers and 900 solution providers across 11 countries, we drive strategic conversations that deliver real business outcomes. we’ve become a key growth driver for many of the most innovative players in the space.
   

  

 To support our ambitious growth plans, we are seeking experienced Sales Managers to join our dynamic and rapidly growing B2B organization. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in helping businesses grow by owning the entire B2B sales cycle, contribute to our growth by opening accounts in the
 **Norwegian market** 
 benefiting from an attractive commission structure and plenty of career growth opportunities in B2B Sales & Business Excellence.
   

  

**Your Mission**
* Prospecting: Identify and qualify potential clients to build a strong sales pipeline.
* Business Development: Initiate contact with prospects through calls, LinkedIn, and email.
* Consultative Sales: Conduct in-depth needs assessments to uncover customer pain points and present tailored solutions.
* Account Management: Build and nurture long-term relationships with new clients.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to achieve shared goals.
* Full Sales Cycle Ownership: Manage the entire sales process, from initial outreach to closing deals.
* Account Growth: Continuously work to expand and strengthen your accounts, increasing revenue and ensuring customer success with support from the Customer Success department.


**About You**
* A proven track record in B2B sales
* A self-starter with a strong work ethic and a desire to succeed
* Experience in a fast-paced, target-driven environment
* The ability to build rapport and trust with clients
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in Norwegian with fluency in English


**About Management Events**
* Comprehensive 4 weeks onboarding and ongoing support
* Great earning potentials with base salary, uncapped commission, and quarterly bonuses
* Earn up to 12 additional vacation days on top of the annual vacation days
* Well-being benefits such as gym and massage discounts
* Regular social events and team-building activities
* Be part of the culture, where we enjoy spending time together and work together towards our targets!
* We offer thorough training in our international ME Academy and continuous training and self-development opportunities during your employment.
* Join the international growth organization with plenty of opportunities! ME has been awarded several times as one of the Best Places to Work in Europe (by Great Place to Work Institute).
* See the video: What’s it like to work at ME?


**Recruitment Process**
* Screening video call with with recruitment
* First interview with hiring manager
* Second interview (including role-play) with team manager
* Reference check


**Our Growth Partnership Solutions Include**
**Guaranteed 1-to-1 Executive Meetings**
 Tailored introductions with senior decision-makers, handpicked by our customers to align with their strategic objectives.
   

  

**Exclusive Networking Experiences**
 Curated, invitation-only events that foster meaningful dialogue with key stakeholders and future partners.
   

  

**Brand Positioning & Thought Leadership**
 Opportunities to showcase expertise and influence target audiences through targeted content and speaking engagements.

title: Bid Manager (SaaS)
description:
Do you know procurement inside and out and are ready to take the lead in a fast-paced SaaS company? Look no further. We’re searching for a Bid Manager to join us in Stockholm or Gothenburg. You'll be the one who ensures that one of our most business-critical processes runs smoothly and efficiently.
 



 At Stratsys we offer a SaaS platform that streamlines compliance in essential areas such as Sustainability, GRC, and Quality management, both in the public and private sector. Unlike other compliance tools, we go beyond reporting by helping organizations move into action and effectively distribute responsibility internally.
 



 Your mission? To keep our bids on track and moving forward. You’ll collaborate closely with sales, legal, partner teams and other stakeholders to drive the process from initial signals all the way to signed contracts. Sometimes hands-on, sometimes strategic, always in control. You set the structure, ask the right questions, and ensure we win the right business.
 



  





**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? 💡** 



* Take ownership of a critical function that directly impacts company growth and success – your work will shape how we win new business
* Join a high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Check out our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Work from a fantastic and central office in A House the Ark in Stockholm or at Kungsportplatsen in Gothenburg.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!



  





**About The Role 📌** 




 As Bid Manager, you lead our full bid process from go/no-go decision to final submission. You’ll work on a broad range of bids – from public sector procurement under LOU to complex RFPs from enterprise customers in the private sector. You create structure, drive momentum and make sure every bid reflects high quality. You work closely with the sales team. They drive the commercial side, you own the process. You set timelines, raise the right questions and keep everything on track.
 



  





 This role is all about collaboration. You collect input from key stakeholders and collaborate across teams, partners, and framework suppliers to ensure smooth delivery. You manage complexity, bring clarity and keep things moving. Once we commit to a bid, you run the project in Loopio, align everyone involved and ensure the final result is complete, compliant and compelling. You follow up on outcomes and feed insights back into the business. You play a key role in helping us win the right deals, and you’re motivated by seeing your work lead to real results.
 



  





 You lead and coordinate all parts of the bid process from decision to submission, including:
 


* Developing and driving our overall bid and procurement strategy – ensuring alignment with our offering, target customers, and commercial goals
* Driving structure, clarity, and follow-up across teams
* Monitoring market and procurement trends, as well as public and private sector regulations, to optimize our bids
* Gathering input from key stakeholders and collaborating across teams, partners, and framework suppliers to ensure smooth delivery
* Taking ownership of Loopio – managing and reusing content, and continuously improving how we use the tool to make our bid process smarter and more efficient
* Identifying and flagging risks in the bid process, and proposing strategies to improve bid design. Taking responsibility for detecting deviations from the product offering, commercial terms, delivery, and Ideal Customer Profile (ICP)
* Tracking and evaluating the outcomes of procurement processes to ensure continuous learning and ongoing improvement of our bidding strategy and execution
* Contributing to winning more of the right business
* Continuously improving our bid process – identifying bottlenecks, streamlining workflows, and implementing best practices to ensure smarter, faster, and higher quality bids over time



  





**YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️** 



* Educational background from either a university or a vocational (YH) program in a relevant field
* 4+ years of experience working with bids and complex procurement processes
* Strong understanding of structured bidding, decision points, and stakeholder management
* Practical knowledge of public procurement regulations including LOU
* Proven ability to lead projects and coordinate cross-functional collaboration
* Comfortable using tools to support your work – ideally Loopio or similar
* Fluent in Swedish and English



  





**It is not a requirement but a bonus if you have:** 



* Experience from a sales role or leadership position within sales – beneficial, especially within SaaS
* Experience working closely with legal teams
* Familiarity with regulations such as CSDDD, NIS2, Åpenhetsloven, etc.



  





**About You 👀** 




 You are highly organized and business-minded with a strong drive to get things done. You enjoy balancing strategic, long-term thinking with close attention to detail, and you thrive in working hands-on to move projects forward and make things happen. You are not afraid to ask important and sometimes difficult questions, and you challenge assumptions when needed. Your clear communication and collaborative approach help bring people together and keep projects on track.
 



 You’re not here to drown in admin – you value structure and quality but also speed and simplicity. You’re comfortable working with smart tools and automations to eliminate manual work where possible, and you constantly look for ways to improve how we do things. You are humble and approachable, valuing teamwork and open dialogue. You focus on the opportunities that matter most and avoid chasing every lead. You take pride in your work and are motivated by winning business and making a real impact.
 



  





**About Us 🚀** 




 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with selection of candidates.
 



 Is this particular role not quite right for you - Show your interest by connecting with us, we are constantly looking for new talent for our growing business in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Oslo. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Multicloud Solutions Sales Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
 Come and join us! Oracle is leading the digital revolution. We are empowering nearly half a million businesses across the globe to turn untapped potential into real business value. Our
 **Cloud Technology** 
 portfolio offers customers the possibility to operate their IT predictably, securely, and at a lower cost with cloud infrastructure services crafted to run all of their cloud-native, web-scale, and mission-critical workloads. Whether customers chose to work in exclusivity with us or in a multi-cloud environment, with a Public Cloud, hybrid, or dedicated Cloud, our offerings provide specialized deployment, disconnected and intermittently connected operation, high performance, as well as data locality and security.
   

  

 Oracle has set itself apart by developing
 **partnerships** 
 with the other
 **Top Cloud Hyperscalers** 
 in the world and as part of our Cloud Growth strategy, we are opening an opportunity for a
 **Senior Solutions Sales Executive** 
 to work on designated
 **region to support** 
**Cloud platform** 
 selling. The Multicloud Solutions Sales Exec will be accountable for
 **partnering closely with our customers´C-suite and cloud hyperscalers such as Google, AWS, MSFT.** 
 The
 **Multicloud Solutions Sales** 
 will play a critical role helping develop new business opportunities within a customer’s region, nurturing existing and long lasting senior relationships at our customers and in partnership with Google, AWS, MSFT, and contributing to new contracts and projects with these customers to drive Cloud consumption and achieve revenue growth. In this role you will be a critical member of our EMEA Technology community.
   

  

**Description What You’ll Do**
 Be the vital piece of the puzzle that connects us to the millions of businesses that need our help to evolve. You will.
   

  

* Help develop and maintain senior and long lasting relationships with Key customers to understand their needs and identify new opportunities and partner closely with counterparts at Google, AWS, MSFT based on the setup of our customers.
* Provide your Cloud Solutions expertise to help IaaS/PaaS technology deals across customers in your region using world leading cloud offerings from Oracle
* Promote and evangelize Oracle products to a selected customer, partners, and internal audiences
* Contribute in account planning, customer/market analysis, and strategy sessions
* Develop relationships and collaborate with our partners to define, recommend, and drive sales
* Expert in developing appropriate sales programs and solutions; maintain up-to-date competitive information and compile regional success stories
* Work closely with the sales team, counterparts at Google, AWS, MSFT to identify and pursue new business opportunities on the targeted account or provide opportunity support for Prime Sales teams and Partner Sales teams within your territory.
* Collaborate with our Cloud Architects and Technical Specialists to develop and deliver customized solutions for customers.
* Encourage and support the adoption and consumption of our IT operation management as well as monitoring in the cloud.
* Lead successful go-to-market campaigns by working closely with internal marketing specialists
* Be a champion for Oracle’s Cloud strategy, capable of articulating this to customers and partners
* Build and maintain relationships with relevant Oracle LOBs to ensure resources are available when required.


**Responsibilities**
**What You’ll Bring**
 Your passion, knowledge, and customer-centricity will help us become the number one cloud company in the world. We also look for:
   

  

* A strong interest in technology, passion for sales and strong communication skills.
* Solution seller: Able to understand quickly business needs and establish trust. Must be able to show the full value proposition of Oracle Cloud. Not only the technical side of selling Cloud but the business gain for the customer.
* Connected: Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with customers. Able to use Oracle ecosystem to navigate within a customer to identify targets and opportunities. Establish close partnership with counterparts at Google, AWS, MSFT,
* Proven track record of success in driving revenue growth and achieving sales targets.
* Cloud confident : Able to outline the full Oracle Cloud picture and explain Universal Credits commercials
* Hands-On : Able to personally demo or give quick hands-on example of Cloud usage “on the spot”, without needing to always engage technical resources
* Value driven : Able to identify real use-cases for Cloud in the customer that drive value for the customer and can lead to rapid expansion of original deals
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities.
* Proven successful and highly attuned influencing skills.
* Proficient in English.


 Does this sound like you? If so, we hope to meet you!
   

  

*At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences—we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion and to create the future we need people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before*
**Qualifications**
 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request\_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: SAP Solution Architect (Nuclear Business)
description:
Vattenfall is recognized as one of the first movers in the energy transition – and by that power climate smarter living for all our customers.
   

  

 Yet, our investment power, innovation, and ambitious change agenda to become fossil free in one generation, can only be met if we can rely on the reliable and competivive generation of our Nuclear plants. To face this challenge we invest in our people and we continue to employ exceptional IT talent. With our team, we are advancing Vattenfall Nuclear to become a data driven company, allowing them to optimize decision making and investment planning.
   

  

**This Means We Are Architecting**
* Our enterprise asset management and logistics on SAP S/4HANA
* An integrated and hybrid SAP and surrounding systems landscape consisting of multiple instances (cloud and onpremise)
* Solutions that are critical to Swedish infrastructure and its society and thus regulated under Säkerhetsskyddslag (2018:585)
* Full IT/OT convergence to ensure frictionless transfer of data (near) real time to advance predictive maintenance use cases
* IT infrastructure and solutions that are hyper-scalable and reliable
* Strategic solutions/landscapes to optimize Nuclear maintenance strategies


 Our team requires true Business facing Solution architects; You know how to use technology to make Nuclear run as
 *clockwork* 
 , you act as
 *timer* 
 to ensure we meet our ambitious goals and be an
 *alarm* 
 if we can do better! We have a large SAP and Microsoft footprint, with more than 20.000 users in six countries
   

  

 Our Group IT Architecture team of 30 enterprise / solution architects is involved in around 100+ key projects at any time, focusing on enterprise architecture and solution architecture for all Vattenfall business units. We act as the hub to understand business needs and to see the bigger Vattenfall picture to help our teams securely adopt the technologies of tomorrow.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* You will join the larger strategic projects, to guide them into successful execution based on fit-for-purpose architecture
* You will consult and educate the Nuclear business on SAP, IT strategy, integration strategy, data strategy and SAP strategy, etc
* You have a solid understanding of IT security and will support Nuclear in fit-for-purpose adoption.
* You will have (or build up) Nuclear and SAP domain knowledge to become the go-to point how advance its S/4 journey.
* You will help us grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles. You will be our trusted advisor towards our Nuclear and other business area’s to enable their operating model by technology – also if that is that means radical change!


**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Our ideal candidate**
 We are looking for a seasoned Solution Architect, that has hands-on experience with SAP solution architecture, preferably (in prior assignments) as SAP Architect in water or energy utilities, manufacturing, or automotive.
   

  

 You Feel Comfortable Communicating With Both IT And Non-IT Colleagues On Different Levels In The Organization. You Enjoy Being In An Ever-changing Environment. Furthermore, You Bring
   

  

* An academic degree in IT or related study
* You speak Swedish and English
* Experience with Enterprise Architecture and Frameworks in an international environment
* You have deep SAP technical knowledge and general IT knowledge
* Ideally you have worked in an asset intensive industry – and understand security considerations, IEC 62443, ISO27001 etc.
* Experience with Microsoft Azure Well Architected Framework
* Skills to produce enterprise ready architecture documents and todirect complex problems into concise Management Board action
* And we love architects talk business and know TOGAF, rather than those that talk TOGAF and know business …


**Location** 
 : for this position you are expected to be already based in Sweden with willingness to travel regularly to the office (Stockholm, Solna). Occasionally also travel to key Nuclear locations, like Ringhals, Forsmark, Oskarshamm or team meetings in Amsterdam and Berlin; You will be expected to travel approximately a once month for two days to these locations.
   

  

**Our Offer**
* Become part of a massive transformative purpose – not on paper, but in real-life – whereby you can influence the outcome!
* We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* You will work in an interdisciplinary team with other senior IT Architects – so we do this together!
* A professional environment where your experience, knowledge and attitude will bring us one step further and the opportunity for you to grow further.
* A central office location with easy access by public transport.
* Furthermore, a healthy work-life balance (smart working) and time to develop your profession
* At Vattenfall you get the opportunity to work for a clean energy company that aims for creating fossil free energy within one generation.
* And last but not least; International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic, motivated colleagues that like to have fun as well!


 Additional Information
   

  

**About Vattenfall**
 Energy is our contribution to quality of life – day after day. With around 20.000 colleagues Vattenfall provides comprehensive electricity and heating offerings to several million customers in northern Europe. For the work ahead we need people who are fully dedicated to our customers and to a sustainable society – people like you.
   

  

**More information**
 We welcome your application in English, including CV and cover letter via our website. For information about the position, please contact recruiting manager Emile Das, +31 6 5250 4359. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Folmer Koper +31 6 38710915.
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. We continue to seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, ethnic and cultural backgrounds.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

title: Integrationsspecialist
description:
*Vill du jobba med marknadens bästa digitala tjänster inom bank och försäkring? Har du erfarenhet av att utveckla och förvalta komplexa integrationslösningar och beskriver dig själv som lösningsorienterad, kommunikativ, flexibel och transparent? Då kan du vara vår nästa Integrationsspecialist!*  


**Om jobbet**

I rollen som integrationsspecialist arbetar du i integrationsteamet. Tillsammans med teamet ansvarar du för att förvalta, vidareutveckla och testa våra integrationslösningar. Du samarbetar med personer från alla miljöer som är involverade i utbytet av information inom bank- och försäkringsområdet.  



Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
* Vidareutveckla (konfigurera) lösningar för API-regler och vår automatiserade releasepipeline
* Bidra med att analysera, ta fram, testa samt beskriva behov av förbättringar
* Vara teknisk samt funktionell expert på befintlig API-plattform
* Bevaka och hantera buggar, problem och incidenter
* Stötta API-producenter och konsumerande applikationer med granskning, testning, onboarding, felsökning, statistik med mera
* Vara teknisk samt funktionell expert på befintlig miljö

  


**Vem är du?**

Förljande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
* Lång erfarenhet inom integrationsområdet och arbetat som utvecklare i minst 5 år
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och förvalta komplexa integrationslösningar
* God förståelse för RESTful design
* Erfarenhet av API-plattformar
* Erfarenhet av agila ramverk och metoder (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe)
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i Python eller Java, .NET/C#
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Linux-plattformar

  



Meriterande är även om du har:
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps samt Microsoft TFS CI/CD-pipelines eller motsvarande CI/CD-teknik
* Kunskap inom Openshift/Kubernetes/Docker
* Förståelse för JWT, OAuth
* Erfarenhet av GIT
* Erfarenhet av Apache Camel
* Erfarenhet av ActiveMQ, Confluent Kafka eller motsvarande eventdrivna plattformar

  



Som person drivs du av att ständigt förbättra dig själv och ditt team med avseende på leveransförmåga och kvalitet. Du trivs med ett agilt arbetssätt och förstår att det är en förutsättning för att lyckas. Du är glad och positiv och uppmuntrar dina kollegor med ärlig feedback. Du har ett drivande och väl fungerande självledarskap och samarbetar och kommunicerar obehindrat med olika beställare samt underleverantörer för utveckling, test och drift. Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska är ett krav då vi jobbar i en outsourcad miljö, med olika underleverantörer för utveckling, test och drift.  


**Om oss**

Vi på Länsförsäkringar bygger något fantastiskt tillsammans, och vi vill att du ska vara en del av det. Här får du inte bara möjlighet att arbeta med spännande teknik – du får också en chans att utvecklas i din roll, påverka den tekniska riktningen och bidra till en kultur som bygger på öppenhet, respekt och innovation.  



Vi tror på att skapa en arbetsmiljö där alla känner sig inkluderade och värdefulla. Vi uppmuntrar nytänkande och idéer, och vi ger dig det stöd du behöver för att växa både professionellt och personligt. Här får du vara med och göra skillnad, och du får också en möjlighet att arbeta tillsammans med skickliga och passionerade kollegor som alla strävar mot samma mål. Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär?  


**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
***Observera att svarstiden för denna rekryteringsprocess kan vara längre än vanligt, detta på grund av semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt.***
**Sista ansökningsdag:** **2025-08-01**
  
Kort om tjänsten


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare
**Arbetsplats:** Sundsvall
**Chef:** Robert Zetterqvist
**Kontaktuppgifter:** robert.zetterqvist@lansforsakringar.se
Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?


Bli en del av något större och börja jobba hos oss. En karriär hos Länsförsäkringar handlar lika mycket om att vara en hjälpande hand för våra kunder genom alla livets skeenden som att stärka lokalsamhället där du verkar.

title: Consultant
description:
Malmo
4.5-8 Years
Sweden
**No. of Positions**


1
**Job Description (Posting).**

DevOps Engineer  

Sweden

**Job Summary:**

* We are seeking an experienced DevOps Engineer with expertise in Azure cloud platforms and a strong background in Terraform automation to join our dynamic team.
* The ideal candidate will be highly skilled in automating infrastructure, specifically setting up and managing Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) using Terraform. You should also have extensive experience working with GitHub Actions, GitOps, CI/CD pipelines, and ArgoCD to streamline application delivery and improve operational efficiency.
* This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing organization and work on cutting-edge cloud technologies and DevOps practices.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Terraform Automation: Develop, implement, and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform to automate the provisioning of Azure resources, with a focus on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters and associated infrastructure.
* AKS Setup & Management: Automate the full lifecycle of AKS clusters, from creation, configuration, and scaling to troubleshooting, using Terraform and Azure native tools.
* CI/CD Pipelines: Design and implement CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions to enable continuous integration and deployment across environments.
* GitOps Practices: Implement and manage GitOps workflows using tools like ArgoCD to automate application deployment directly from Git repositories.
* Automation & Orchestration: Automate and streamline deployment processes for microservices, containerized applications, and serverless functions using tools such as Terraform, Kubernetes, and ArgoCD.
* Infrastructure Monitoring & Management: Monitor and ensure high availability, performance, and security of cloud infrastructure, and troubleshoot issues in the AKS environment.
* Version Control and Collaboration: Work with development teams to integrate source control management (GitHub) for infrastructure code, application code, and configuration files.
* Security & Compliance: Implement security best practices in Terraform code, AKS clusters, and throughout the CI/CD pipeline (e.g., secrets management, access control).
* Documentation & Best Practices: Maintain documentation for infrastructure configurations, CI/CD processes, and security standards. Follow and advocate for DevOps best practices.

**Required Skills & Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
* 3+ years of experience in DevOps or Cloud Engineering roles.
* Strong experience with Terraform for infrastructure automation, specifically on Azure platform.
* Expertise in managing Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), including configuration, deployment, and scaling.
* Hands-on experience with GitHub Actions to automate workflows and CI/CD pipelines.
* Knowledge of GitOps principles and workflows, with practical experience using ArgoCD for continuous deployment.
* Solid experience in designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines using modern tools and practices.
* Proficient in Git, Docker, and Kubernetes.
* Strong scripting skills in Bash, PowerShell, or Python.
* Familiarity with Azure services such as Azure Functions, App Services, Key Vault, Storage Accounts, and Networking.
* Understanding of cloud security best practices, especially in the context of Kubernetes and Azure cloud environments.

* Independently manage development tasks and initiatives, even in the absence of clear direction.

**Qualifications:**

* Senior-level proficiency in Python.
* Experience with Ansible.Experience with Linux system.
* Proven DevOps experience, including CI/CD workflows.
* Solid understanding of software development processes and best practices.
* 4-5 years of experience in network automation.
* Expertise in network engineering, particularly with routing, switching, and Cisco/Aruba technologies.
* Ability to work effectively both as part of a team and independently.

title: Senior Network Automation Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

We are a IT & Tech consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!


We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.  

  

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level. With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated **Senior Network Automation Engineer** to join our team in Stockholm. You will play a critical role in driving our network automation journey, leveraging your expertise in Python, Ansible, and DevOps practices. You will design and implement solutions that improve network reliability, scalability, and efficiency, working across teams and independently on strategic initiatives.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and implement **network automation solutions** using Python and Ansible.
* Manage and maintain **Linux-based systems** that support automation platforms.
* Apply **DevOps principles**, including **CI/CD** workflows, to streamline automation delivery.
* Lead and oversee **software development processes**, including testing, code review, and release management.
* Work with **routing and switching technologies**, with a focus on **Cisco and Aruba** environments.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (network, security, software) to align automation with business and infrastructure needs.
* Take ownership of development tasks and initiatives, even in situations with limited direction or ambiguous requirements.

 **Qualifications*** **4–5 years of experience** in network automation engineering.
* Advanced proficiency in **Python programming**.
* Hands-on experience with **Ansible** for configuration management and network orchestration.
* Solid knowledge of **Linux system administration**.
* Proven experience in **DevOps practices**, especially **CI/CD pipeline** implementation and management.
* Understanding of software development methodologies and best practices (testing, version control, documentation).
* Strong knowledge of **network engineering concepts**, particularly in **routing, switching**, and experience with **Cisco and Aruba technologies**.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work both **independently** and **collaboratively**.

 **Additional Information** **Start:** Immediately  

**Location:** Stockholm

**Work Schedule:** Full-time, Monday–Friday  

**Form of employment:** Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months of probationary employment

title: Vice President Product & Digital Engineering
description:
*At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation & technology. In 2023 we launched our new mother brand, Strawberry, and we are transforming from a traditional hotel company to a universe of offers and experiences for our guests and customers.*



We are seeking a visionary **Vice President Product & Digital Engineering.** You will be instrumental in delivering innovative and seamless digital experiences that drive commercial growth and maximize operational efficiency. Leading our teams across Tech Product, Digital Engineering, Integration and QA, you will cultivate a world-class engineering culture and ensure the scalability, security, and performance of all digital solutions.



If you possess strong technical and strategic acumen, commercial insight, and a talent for building impactful relationships, we want to hear from you.



What you will be doing:


* **Tech Product & Technical Vision:** Define and champion the tech product vision and technical roadmap for tech products, platforms, and AI-powered solutions, ensuring deep alignment with business objectives and a cost-effective product policy.
* **User-Centered Design:** Lead a selection of our Product & Design teams in creating intuitive, engaging, and effective user experiences for guests and employees, grounded in solid user research and technical feasibility.
* **Engineering Excellence**: Direct the Digital Engineering teams through the full lifecycle of developing, deploying, and maintaining highly scalable, secure, and performant digital solutions, championing modern engineering practices and architectural principles.
* **Platform & API Strategy:** Drive the evolution of our core API and platform capabilities to ensure seamless system integration, reusability, and robust extensibility for future growth.
* **Quality & Security:** Enforce rigorous standards for software quality, performance, security, and data governance, overseeing QA functions and advocating for automation, CI/CD pipelines, and responsible AI practices.
* **Leadership & Mentorship**: Build, mentor, and develop high-performing teams across Tech Product and Engineering, fostering a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration**: Work effectively across functions to translate business needs into clear, technically feasible tech product requirements and engineering specifications.
* **Financial Management**: Develop and manage the comprehensive budget for the technology product development organization, ensuring effective resource allocation.

Who we think you are:


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Product Management, or a related technical field; a Master’s degree is preferred.
* 10+ years of progressive experience in product management and/or digital engineering leadership roles.
* A proven track record of successfully launching impactful digital products and scalable platforms, with demonstrable experience leading the development of AI-powered features.
* Deep understanding of product development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Lean, OKR), modern architectures, and CI/CD and DevOps principles.
* Significant experience leading and scaling cross-functional product, design, and engineering teams.
* Strong foundational knowledge of API design (REST, GraphQL), microservices, cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), and AI/ML principles.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical and AI strategies to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong commercial acumen and the ability to align technical decisions with business value and ROI.
* Experience within the hospitality industry is a plus.


  

What we offer:


**Real Impact:** Be a part of a dynamic transformation and contribute directly to our success story.
  

**Empowerment:** Work in a flat organization with trust, autonomy, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
  

**Growth & Development:** Access professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
  

**Fun & Community:** Enjoy a vibrant work environment with plenty of social events and team-building activities.
  

**Fantastic Perks:** Benefit from great employee discounts, including staff and friends & family rates at our hotels.
  

**Flexible Work:** Embrace a hybrid working model with your base at our HQ in Oslo or Stockholm.



You will be a part of the leadership team in the Tech department, and report directly to CDTO, Kari Anna Fiskvik.



Interested in joining our team?  

We'd love to get to know you! At Strawberry, we celebrate individuality and potential, and invite all to apply. Upload your CV and cover letter, sharing why this position excites you.

description:
Malmo

Sweden

1
**Job Description (Posting).**

DevOps Engineer  

Sweden

 **Job Summary:**

* We are seeking an experienced DevOps Engineer with expertise in Azure cloud platforms and a strong background in Terraform automation to join our dynamic team.
* The ideal candidate will be highly skilled in automating infrastructure, specifically setting up and managing Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) using Terraform. You should also have extensive experience working with GitHub Actions, GitOps, CI/CD pipelines, and ArgoCD to streamline application delivery and improve operational efficiency.
* This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing organization and work on cutting-edge cloud technologies and DevOps practices.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Terraform Automation: Develop, implement, and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform to automate the provisioning of Azure resources, with a focus on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters and associated infrastructure.
* AKS Setup & Management: Automate the full lifecycle of AKS clusters, from creation, configuration, and scaling to troubleshooting, using Terraform and Azure native tools.
* CI/CD Pipelines: Design and implement CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions to enable continuous integration and deployment across environments.
* GitOps Practices: Implement and manage GitOps workflows using tools like ArgoCD to automate application deployment directly from Git repositories.
* Automation & Orchestration: Automate and streamline deployment processes for microservices, containerized applications, and serverless functions using tools such as Terraform, Kubernetes, and ArgoCD.
* Infrastructure Monitoring & Management: Monitor and ensure high availability, performance, and security of cloud infrastructure, and troubleshoot issues in the AKS environment.
* Version Control and Collaboration: Work with development teams to integrate source control management (GitHub) for infrastructure code, application code, and configuration files.
* Security & Compliance: Implement security best practices in Terraform code, AKS clusters, and throughout the CI/CD pipeline (e.g., secrets management, access control).
* Documentation & Best Practices: Maintain documentation for infrastructure configurations, CI/CD processes, and security standards. Follow and advocate for DevOps best practices.

**Required Skills & Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
* 3+ years of experience in DevOps or Cloud Engineering roles.
* Strong experience with Terraform for infrastructure automation, specifically on Azure platform.
* Expertise in managing Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), including configuration, deployment, and scaling.
* Hands-on experience with GitHub Actions to automate workflows and CI/CD pipelines.
* Knowledge of GitOps principles and workflows, with practical experience using ArgoCD for continuous deployment.
* Solid experience in designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines using modern tools and practices.
* Proficient in Git, Docker, and Kubernetes.
* Strong scripting skills in Bash, PowerShell, or Python.
* Familiarity with Azure services such as Azure Functions, App Services, Key Vault, Storage Accounts, and Networking.
* Understanding of cloud security best practices, especially in the context of Kubernetes and Azure cloud environments.

**Qualification**


B-Tech
**Employee Group**


Business Line FT
**City**


Malmö
**Entity**

title: Vice President Product & Digital Engineering
description:
We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation & technology. In 2023 we launched our new mother brand, Strawberry, and we are transforming from a traditional hotel company to a universe of offers and experiences for our guests and customers.*



We are seeking a visionary **Vice President Product & Digital Engineering.** You will be instrumental in delivering innovative and seamless digital experiences that drive commercial growth and maximize operational efficiency. Leading our teams across Tech Product, Digital Engineering, Integration and QA, you will cultivate a world-class engineering culture and ensure the scalability, security, and performance of all digital solutions.



If you possess strong technical and strategic acumen, commercial insight, and a talent for building impactful relationships, we want to hear from you.


#### **What you will be doing:**


* **Tech Product & Technical Vision:** Define and champion the tech product vision and technical roadmap for tech products, platforms, and AI-powered solutions, ensuring deep alignment with business objectives and a cost-effective product policy.
* **User-Centered Design:** Lead a selection of our Product & Design teams in creating intuitive, engaging, and effective user experiences for guests and employees, grounded in solid user research and technical feasibility.
* **Engineering Excellence**: Direct the Digital Engineering teams through the full lifecycle of developing, deploying, and maintaining highly scalable, secure, and performant digital solutions, championing modern engineering practices and architectural principles.
* **Platform & API Strategy:** Drive the evolution of our core API and platform capabilities to ensure seamless system integration, reusability, and robust extensibility for future growth.
* **Quality & Security:** Enforce rigorous standards for software quality, performance, security, and data governance, overseeing QA functions and advocating for automation, CI/CD pipelines, and responsible AI practices.
* **Leadership & Mentorship**: Build, mentor, and develop high-performing teams across Tech Product and Engineering, fostering a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration**: Work effectively across functions to translate business needs into clear, technically feasible tech product requirements and engineering specifications.
* **Financial Management**: Develop and manage the comprehensive budget for the technology product development organization, ensuring effective resource allocation.

#### **Who we think you are:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Product Management, or a related technical field; a Master’s degree is preferred.
* 10+ years of progressive experience in product management and/or digital engineering leadership roles.
* A proven track record of successfully launching impactful digital products and scalable platforms, with demonstrable experience leading the development of AI-powered features.
* Deep understanding of product development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Lean, OKR), modern architectures, and CI/CD and DevOps principles.
* Significant experience leading and scaling cross-functional product, design, and engineering teams.
* Strong foundational knowledge of API design (REST, GraphQL), microservices, cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), and AI/ML principles.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical and AI strategies to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong commercial acumen and the ability to align technical decisions with business value and ROI.
* Experience within the hospitality industry is a plus.


#### 
**What we offer:**


**Real Impact:** Be a part of a dynamic transformation and contribute directly to our success story.
  

**Empowerment:** Work in a flat organization with trust, autonomy, and the opportunity to make a real difference.
  

**Growth & Development:** Access professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
  

**Fun & Community:** Enjoy a vibrant work environment with plenty of social events and team-building activities.
  

**Fantastic Perks:** Benefit from great employee discounts, including staff and friends & family rates at our hotels.
  

**Flexible Work:** Embrace a hybrid working model with your base at our HQ in Oslo or Stockholm.



You will be a part of the leadership team in the Tech department, and report directly to CDTO, Kari Anna Fiskvik.

**We'd love to get to know you! At Strawberry, we celebrate individuality and potential, and invite all to apply. Upload your CV and cover letter, sharing why this position excites you.**

title: Senior DevOps Engineer 678
description:
At Protegrity, we lead innovation by using AI and quantum-resistant cryptography to transform data protection across cloud-native, hybrid, on-premises, and open source environments. We leverage advanced cryptographic methods such as tokenization, format-preserving encryption, and quantum-resilient techniques to protect sensitive data. As a global leader in data security, our mission is to ensure that data isn’t just valuable but also usable, trusted, and safe.
Protegrity offers the opportunity to work at the intersection of innovation and collaboration, with the ability to make a meaningful impact on the industry while working alongside some of the brightest minds. Together, we are redefining how the world safeguards data, enabling organizations to thrive in a GenAI era where data is the ultimate currency. If you're ready to shape the future of data security, Protegrity is the place for you.

**Join Our Team as a Senior DevOps:**


As a Senior Mainframe DevOps Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in driving the adoption and execution of DevOps practices within the organisation, with a strong focus on mainframe environments. This position is instrumental in bridging the gap between traditional mainframe development and modern DevOps methodologies, fostering seamless collaboration and accelerating the delivery of high-quality software solutions.


You will have the unique opportunity to define, architect, and manage the CI/CD strategy for a diverse and complex ecosystem of software products spanning multiple platforms, with a primary emphasis on z/OS systems. Your expertise will be critical in streamlining development workflows, enhancing automation, and ensuring consistent and reliable software delivery.

**Responsibilities:**

* You should be able to Design, Develop, Test and Maintain CI/CD pipeline, and ability to maintain continuous integration, delivery, and deployment (CI/CD) process for a complex set of software requirements and products spread across multiple platforms.
* You will receive comprehensive training on existing zOS product applications and assembly processes, with a focus on developing and implementing CI/CD capabilities tailored for mainframe systems.
* Monitoring and managing infrastructure, ensuring optimal performance, security, and scalability.
* Defining and setting development, test, release, update, and support processes for DevOps operations.
* Troubleshooting and resolving issues related to application development, deployment, and operations.
* You should understand how to choose the best tools and technologies which best fit business needs.
* Individuals should be able to lead platform upgrade/migration/maintenance independently.
* Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends, then utilise them to enhance the software infrastructure.

**Qualifications:**

* BE/BTECH or any other degree in the related field.
* 3-5 years of relevant DevOps experience.
* Hands-On experience on various DevOps concepts and tools like Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) using various tools like Git, Jenkins, Artifactory/Nexus etc.
* Strong knowledge of Shell Scripting and any other programming languages such as Python, C, Groovy, Java, YAML.
* Experience working on Linux infrastructure.
* Familiarity with IBM z/OS-based infrastructure is advantageous, particularly in hybrid enterprise environments.
* Experiential learning on Infrastructure as Code tools (like Terraform, Ansible).
* Hands-On experience on Container & Container Orchestration tools like Docker, AWS ECS, Kubernetes and infrastructure monitoring tools like Prometheus and Grafana.
* Experience with designing, building, and maintaining cloud-native applications across major cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP is a strong plus.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, as well as the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams including nearshore and offshore.

**Why Choose Protegrity**

* We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package as well as the Become a member of a leading Data Protection, Privacy and Security company during one of the best market opportunities to come along in a generation.
* Competitive Compensation/Total Reward Packages that include:
* Paid Time Off (PTO).
* Annual Bonus Incentives.
* Work on global projects with diverse, energetic, team members who respect each other and celebrate differences.
* Talent First Workforce.

**Working Model:**

* This role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend on-site meetings only occasionally based on business needs. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.


Should you accept this position, you will be required to consent to and successfully complete a background investigation. This may include, subject to local laws, verification of extended education and additional criminal and civil checks.


We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits with generous vacation and holiday time off. All employees are also provided access to ongoing learning & development.

  

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace is our priority. We are committed to an environment of acceptance where you are free to bring your full self to work. All qualified applicants and current employees will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability or veteran status.

  

Please reference Section 12: Supplemental Notice for Job Applicants in our Privacy Policy to inform you of the categories of personal information that we collect from individuals who inquire about and/or apply to work for Protegrity USA, Inc., or its parent company, subsidiaries or affiliates, and the purposes for which we use such personal information.

description:

 Good to have Azure Certification
 



  





**Job Description** 
 :
 



 DevOps Engineer / Azure Infrastructure Automation Specialist to assist with our Teams Bot deployment project.
 



 The ideal candidate needs to have strong hands-on experience in:
 


* Azure Infrastructure: VMSS, Service Fabric, Storage Accounts, NSGs, and Kusto Queries.
* PowerShell Scripting: Modifying and automating existing deployment scripts.
* GitHub Actions: Setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines for infrastructure and application deployments.

title: Data Infrastructure Engineer/ DevOps Infrastructure Engineer
description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Infrastructure Engineer to help build and manage a robust data platform that supports data-driven applications at scale. The role involves working on cloud-native services, automation, and ensuring secure and efficient data flow across systems. If you're passionate about infrastructure and enjoy solving complex data challenges, this might be the right opportunity for you.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Design, develop, and maintain scalable cloud-based data services.
* Build and manage CI/CD pipelines and automation processes.
* Monitor and improve system performance and reliability.
* Implement security best practices across infrastructure and data workflows.
* Participate in on-call rotations to support production systems.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* 5+ years of experience in an engineering or DevOps role.
* Proven experience with large-scale cloud infrastructure.
* Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
* Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, Go, or Python).
* Experience with data workflow tools such as dbt or Apache Airflow.
* Solid understanding of cloud security practices.

title: Senior IAM Engineer | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about new technology and making a difference? Join our digital transformation!
   

  

 The IAM Platform team is now looking for their new team member. The team consists of about 4 people. We work closely together and share the passion for great technology and creating a smooth engineering experience. Our group consists of people with different expertise, experiences, age and background. We have an open and friendly approach towards each other.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At this position within Hosting & Integration, you will be a part of a highly skilled team working with modern technology, security and developing of the IAM platforms, which are integrated in SEB DevOps toolchains. As a senior IAM Engineer you will create and evolve our IAM platform by investigating, developing, and implementing different technical solutions. This area is highly prioritized which creates many collaborations with various parts of the SEB organization. You will also be involved in SEB cloud journey.
   

  

 Your tasks will include designing, implementing and managing IAM solutions, deploying and managing the IAM Infrastructure, troubleshooting and resolving issues, ensuring compliance with security policies and best practices. In this role you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve the overall security posture of the organization.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* 5 years or more experience within IAM engineering.
* Experience with identity federation technology (ex. OpenID Connect, OAuth2).
* Experience with Single Sign-On and Multi Factor Authentication solution (ex. FIDO2).
* Hands-on experience with DevSecOps tools (e.g. managing platforms with Kubernetes, Git, Github actions).
* Experience of programming languages, such as Python, Java, go or Javascript.
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms.
* Attention to Detail.
* Critical Thinking .


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 16th of June 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Anton Hänni via email at anton.hanni@seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here** 
 : www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Senior Cloud Engineer till SJ
description:
SJ är ett svenskt reseföretag som erbjuder hållbara tågresor – både i egen regi och i samarbete med andra aktörer. Just nu befinner vi oss i en spännande fas med stora satsningar på nya tåg, digitalisering och intern transformation.
   

  

 Vår vision: Genom att bygga på en pålitlig, standardiserad och automatiserad grund, gör vi det enkelt för SJ att skapa och köra digitala produkter som våra kunder älskar. Vill du vara med och driva Sverige – och SJ – framåt?
 **Din kommande roll** 
 Som senior Cloud Engineer får du en nyckelroll i att förverkliga vår vision. Du kommer att designa, implementera och vidareutveckla vår molninfrastruktur och våra plattformstjänster – med målet att skapa en stabil och skalbar grund för digitala produkter som gör skillnad för våra resenärer.
   

  

 Du blir en viktig del i vår satsning på cybersäkerhet och får möjlighet att påverka både teknikval och arbetssätt, exempelvis genom att coacha team i ”shift left”-principer och utveckla säkerhetsplattformar.
   

  

**Teamet du blir en del av** 
 Du kommer att ingå i ett tvärfunktionellt plattformsteam bestående främst av Cloud Engineers och en Engineering Manager. Teamet är hjärtat i SJ:s molnresa – nu inne på vårt sjunde år i Azure – och driver utvecklingen från strategi till verklighet.
   

  

 Vi arbetar nära produktteam och andra delar av organisationen för att möjliggöra snabb, säker och hållbar utveckling av digitala tjänster. Vår vision vägleder oss i allt vi gör: Att bygga en pålitlig, standardiserad och automatiserad grund som gör det enkelt för SJ att skapa och köra digitala produkter som våra kunder älskar.
   

  

**Förväntningar på den vi söker** 
 Vi söker dig som är både nyfiken, strukturerad och som gillar att ligga steget före genom proaktiv övervakning, men som också är trygg i att hantera incidenter när de uppstår. Rollen är bred, och vi vet att ingen kan allt – men om du har viljan att lära och växa tillsammans med oss, kommer du att trivas.Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska i både tal och skrift och du har förmågan att förklara teknik för icke-tekniker. Vi tror att du har erfarenhet inom flera av följande områden:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet molnplattformar: AWS, Azure eller GCP – gärna flera.
* Flera års erfarenhet av infrastructure as Code (IaC): Terraform, Bicep eller liknande verktyg.
* Nätverk: Förståelse för TCP/IP, DNS, VPN m.m.
* Containerisering & orkestrering: Kubernetes, AKS, Docker.
* Övervakning & felsökning: Logganalys, larmhantering, root cause analysis.
* Prestanda & drift: Optimering, skalbarhet, rolling upgrades.
* DevOps: CI/CD, Git, Jenkins, Azure DevOps.
* Dokumentation: Arkitektur, markdown, docs- as code.
* Governance & säkerhet: IAM, kryptering, efterlevnad, policyramverk.
* Molnmigrering: Praktisk erfarenhet av att flytta applikationer till molnet.
* Akademisk utbildning inom data eller IT.


**Därför kommer du att trivas hos oss** 
 På SJ får du vara med och forma framtidens resande. Vi värdesätter mångfald, inkludering och ett ständigt lärande. Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Ett centralt kontor i Stockholm
* Kollektivavtal och förmånliga villkor
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Rabatterade tågresor för dig och din familj
* Möjlighet att påverka både teknik och kultur i en organisation i förändring
* Vi erbjuder en hybrid-modell med möjlighet till flexibilitet.


**Ansökan** 
 Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

title: Platform Engineer
description:

title: Cloud Architect Azure
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Vill du arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser?**
 Sopra Steria, Nordens ledande företag inom digital transformation, söker en erfaren och kompetent Cloud Architect inom Azure med dokumenterad erfarenhet för att stärka vårt framstående team. Vi har blivit erkända som Karriärföretag och en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work. I denna roll kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i leveransen av innovativa molnbaserade projekt till våra kunder samt bidra till vidareutvecklingen av vårt framstående molnerbjudande
   

  

**Som arkitektkonsult inom Azure kommer du att:**
* Delta aktivt i planering, design och implementation av Azure-lösningar för våra kunder.
* Operativt arbeta med lösningar som omfattar hela bredden av Azure-plattformen, inklusive IaaS och PaaS, med fokus på Entra ID för identitets- och åtkomststyrning.
* Coacha och vägleda kunder om optimal användning av moln- och hybridteknologi för att implementera nya lösningar eller migrera befintliga tjänster till Azure.
* Fungera som ämnesexpert som stödjer flera team eller som teknisk teamledare med övergripande ansvar för leveransen.


**För att lyckas med detta tror vi att du:**
* 5 till 8 års dokumenterad erfarenhet som Azure-arkitekt med stark tekniskt fokus och problemlösningsförmåga.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Förmåga att automatisera och optimera arbetsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av att översätta kundens behov till konkreta designförslag och implementeringar.
* Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen med förmåga att arbeta i både stora och små team.


**Kvalifikationer och färdigheter:**
* Erfarenhet av design och implementering av lösningar i det publika molnet, med fokus på kostnadsoptimering, säkerhet, skalbarhet, prestanda och tillgänglighet.
* Kompetens inom programmerings- och/eller skriptspråk (Powershell, Bash, Python etc.).
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg som Azure DevOps eller GitHub.
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (ARM, Bicep, Terraform etc.).
* Förståelse och erfarenhet av ramverk som Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework, Security Adoption Framework samt Well-Architected Framework
* Kunskap inom molnsäkerhet och Zero Trust arkitektur.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av containerlösningar som Docker och Kubernetes är meriterande.


**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är en global aktör inom digital transformation med över 50 000 medarbetare i över 30 länder, varav 600 i Sverige. Vi har blivit rankade som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work och är ett av topp fem bolag inom Digital Transformation enligt Gartner. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och skicklig arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att vässa dina kunskaper och arbeta med branschens mest spännande projekt. Vi står nu inför en spännande tillväxtresa som genomsyrar hela verksamheten där det finns stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med bolaget och skapa verklig förändring genom digital utveckling.
   

  

 Har du fler frågor? Om du har några fler frågor angående tjänsten får du gärna höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare Teodor Nellvik (teodor.nellvik@soprasteria.com).
   

  

 På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Sopra Steria tar inte emot CV:n från företag som vi inte har ramavtal tillsammans med. Vi tar inte ansvar för eventuella avgifter på CV:n som skickas oönskat till oss. To all recruitment agencies without a base agreement: Sopra Steria does not accept resumes from agencies with whom we do not have an agreement. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Sopra Steria employees or any other company location. Sopra Steria is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Rollen som DevOps Engineer innebär att vara med och bidra till att våra utvecklingsplattformar och verktyg fungerar och vidareutvecklas. Dessutom ingår att bidra till att vidareutveckla agila och DevOps-baserade arbetssätt tillsammans med teamet.
   

  

 om tjänsten
   

  

 Arbetsgivare: Svenska kraftnät Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, heltid
   

  

 Placeringsort: Sundbyberg
   

  

 Antal tjänster: 2
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 23 maj 2025 Kvalifikationer: Eftergymnasial IT-utbildning eller motsvarande. Flerårig erfarenhet av DevOps, systemutveckling, versionshantering och verktyg som Azure DevOps, GitLab/GitHub, Atlassian. Vana vid agilt arbete samt mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Meriterande: DevOps-implementation i Linux-/Windowsmiljö, testautomatisering, IT-säkerhet, verktyg som Docker, WSL2, Node.js, Visual Studio, Python.
   

  

 Distansarbete: Möjligt upp till 50 %
   

  

 Tjänsten kommer även att innefatta både koordinerande och planerade arbetsuppgifter samt mer praktiskt och operativt arbete som sker hands-on i våra IT-system, t.ex. konfiguration, felsökning, installationer och uppgraderingar.
   

  

**Exempel På Ansvar Och Arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera incidenter, problem och utföra felsökning.
* Driva och utföra uppgraderingar och systemförbättringar av våra utvecklingsverktyg och Azure DevOps Server-plattform.
* Stödja nya och befintliga projekt och förvaltningar med att införa DevOps-baserat arbetssätt och arbetsytor i Azure DevOps Serverplattformen samt andra utvecklingsverktyg inom området.
* Installera, konfigurera och i övrigt iordningställa nya miljöer, t.ex. för tillkommande behov framöver.
* Delta i arbete med IT-säkerhet genom att bistå vid risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser, omvärldsbevaka informationssäkerhet mm.


 Som DevOps Engineer tillhör du enheten Utvecklingsförmågor och Verktyg som består av cirka 16 personer; IT-specialister, metod- och verktygsansvariga, IT-projektledare och förvaltningsledare. Enheten har bland annat ansvaret för att utveckla våra förmågor inom applikationsutveckling samt krav- och testhantering.
   

  

 Drivs du av att arbeta med ständiga förbättringar och utveckling av verktyg, processer och arbetssätt inom IT-utvecklingsområdet? Hos oss får du möjlighet att leda, påverka och bidra till utvecklingen av vår framtida verksamhet. Inom Svenska kraftnät finns kollegor med lång erfarenhet inom branschen som möjliggör erfarenhetsutbyte och kompetensutveckling. Vi erbjuder möjligheter till utveckling och specialisering inom dina intresseområden.
   

  

 Om dig
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är bra på att samarbeta och har förmåga att hitta de bästa lösningarna med fokus på det gemensamma målet. Du har en stark problemlösningsförmåga och kan se logik och samband i komplex information och miljö. Vidare har du ett strukturerat arbetssätt och kan planera och slutföra det du påbörjat samt möta deadlines. Du är en kreativ person som har ett öppet sinne och hittar nya lösningar på gamla problem. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Skallkrav
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du har utbildning från högskola/universitet/yrkeshögskola inom systemvetenskap eller liknande, alternativt motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har flerårig och aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av:
   

  

* att ha arbetat som systemutvecklare eller DevOps Engineer, med stöd till systemutvecklingsteam där versionshantering har ingått.
* att ha arbetat med konfiguration, drift och övrig hantering av Azure DevOps eller andra liknande verktyg (GitLab/GitHub/Atlassians produkter).
* kodgranskningsverktyg/-system.
* att ha arbetat med agila arbetssätt.


 Du talar samt förstår svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Vi Ser Det Som Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Arbetslivserfarenhet som DevOps Engineer med både införande av DevOps-baserat arbetssätt och verktyg under minst tre år i Linux- och Windows-miljöer.
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av installation, konfiguration och administration av programvaror i Linux- eller Windows–miljö.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom infrastruktur i säkra IT-miljöer (nätverk, brandväggar, säker kommunikation).
* Arbetat med utvecklingsverktyg för testautomatisering.
* Arbetat med utvecklingsverktyg som t.ex. WSL2, Python, Docker, Visual Studio, Node.js.


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg, Stockholm
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-05-23. vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning.


 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor kontakta rekryteringskonsult Carina Eyoma, carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, 073 086 22 75 alternativt ansvarig rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät, Victoria Waltenberg, 010 350 90 45, victoria.waltenberg@svk.se. Rekryterande chef är Jonas Backlund. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning
   

  

 Svenska Kraftnät Arbetar För Att Främja Mångfald Och Motverka Diskriminering Och Ser Gärna Sökanden Med Olika Bakgrund Och Erfarenheter Till Våra Rekryteringar. Lär Känna Svenska Kraftnät Och Hur Det Är Att Arbeta Hos Oss
   

  

 Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 ANSÖK HÄR

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 CGI's Development CoE söker fler duktiga DevOps-tekniker som vill växa tillsammans med oss. Hos oss är det lätt att trivas – vi stöttar varandra, delar kunskap och ser till att ha kul längs vägen. Hos oss är det lätt att vara sig själv, och det finns alltid någon att bolla idéer eller utmaningar med.
   

  

 Vår vardag består av spännande projekt där vi tillsammans hittar smarta lösningar för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett team med bred kompetens och stort hjärta, där samarbete både internt och med våra kunder står i fokus.
   

  

 Och ja, vi gillar att göra saker tillsammans även utanför jobbet – som en spelkväll eller AW då och då – helt frivilligt så klart! Om du vill arbeta i ett globalt företag som är marknadsledande inom IT i Sverige, men samtidigt få känslan av en tight och trygg arbetsgrupp – då tror vi att du kommer trivas riktigt bra hos oss.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Designa, implementera och hantera Azure iPaaS-lösningar, inklusive infrastrukturprovisionering med ARM/Bicep.
* Utveckla och underhålla infrastrukturautomationsskript med Python eller PowerShell.
* Konfigurera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines med Azure DevOps för effektiv bygg- och releasehantering.
* Hantera versionshanteringssystem, upprätthålla Git-arbetsflöden och stödja strategier för grening och sammanslagning.
* Ansvara för hela infrastrukturen under dess livscykel – från miljöuppsättning till övervakning, underhåll och felsökning.
* Stödja byggprocesser, pakethantering och distribution av applikationer i både produktions- och testmiljöer.
* Integrera och underhålla verktyg för kodkvalitet och artefakthantering såsom SonarQube och Artifactory; stödja observabilitet via Elastic Stack eller Splunk.
* Integrera säkerhetskontroller och rutiner i CI/CD-arbetsflöden, med efterlevnad av organisatoriska och regulatoriska standarder.
* Integrera och underhålla verktyg för statisk och dynamisk kodanalys inom utvecklingslivscykeln.
* Implementera härdning av infrastruktur, efterlevnad av konfigurationspolicyer och automatiserat säkerhetsregelverk med exempelvis Azure Policy.
* Samarbeta med säkerhetsteam för att stödja incidentdetektion, analys och respons i molnbaserade plattformar.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik i denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av DevOps-, SecOps- eller molninfrastruktur.
* Stark analytisk förmåga och vana att tolka och implementera komplexa krav.
* Djup kompetens inom Azure iPaaS, Resource Manager och distribution via ARM/Bicep-mallar.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att skriva skript i Python eller PowerShell.
* God kunskap om Azure DevOps pipelines, bygg-/releaseprocesser och applikationsdistribution i olika miljöer.
* Gedigen förståelse för Git, branching strategier och best practices inom versionshantering.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera hela infrastrukturen under dess livscykel, inklusive underhåll, övervakning och felsökning.
* Kännedom om byggverktyg, pakethantering och applikationsserverinfrastruktur.
* Arbetskunskap om databaser, nätverk och integrationsplattformar.
* Erfarenhet av SonarQube, Artifactory och gärna Elastic Stack eller Splunk.
* Förmåga att leda estimeringar, teknisk design, utveckling och distributioner.
* Erfarenhet av att implementera säkerhetsrutiner i CI/CD-pipelines.
* Kännedom om statisk och dynamisk kodanalys för säker kodvalidering.
* Förståelse för infrastrukturhärdning och automatisering av efterlevnad.
* Erfarenhet av att integrera säkerhetsskanningsverktyg (t.ex. sårbarhetsskanning av beroenden).


 Meriterande om du också har:
   

  

* Certifiering: Microsoft Certified – Azure Administrator Associate
* Erfarenhet av hotmodellering och riskbedömningar.
* Kännedom om SIEM-verktyg och plattformar för sårbarhetshantering.


 Vad du kan förvänta dig av oss:
   

  

 Integrationsteamet på CGI är ett gäng som trivs ihop, delar kunskap och stöttar varandra. Här är det lätt att vara sig själv, och det finns alltid någon att bolla idéer med. Ibland gör vi något kul tillsammans efter jobbet, som en spelkväll – bara om man vill, såklart!
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan i dag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna rekryterande konsultchef Ramya Parthasarathy, ramya.parthasarathy@cgi.com eller konsultchef Henrik Sjöstedt, henrik,sjostedt@cgi.com.
   

  

**Vad CGI erbjuder dig**
 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig.
